commit_message:
xenapi: script to rotate the guest logs

Xen will produce the guest logs in a specified directory.

This scripts configures the above logging as expected
by the xapi plugin nova uses to read the logs.
In addition it ensures that any log that grows bigger
than 1MB will be truncated down to 5KB.

Ensuring the log directory is inside a loop back device
of a restricted size, and running this script every
minute using cron, will stop guests from using up
too much Dom0 disk space, and taking out the hypervisor

Part of blueprint xenapi-server-log
Change-Id: I4caa82f4d0620d924e37e3b605cf62b4d5b73570

commit_message:
Optional TCP_KEEPIDLE in unit tests

Allows to run unit tests on BSD-based platforms. The commit
da99c339 that solved the problem doesn't contain fixes of unit
tests.

Change-Id: Iff1771c1cbb37c30a888cd1da4fca5636e5797e7

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-14 20:04:59.000000000', 'message': 'Change server exceptions to show less details

Internal exceptions were dumping error messages raised by
arbitrary python calls and potentially revealing sensitive
details.

The message for all 500 errors is now::

    Internal Server Error. (<UUID>)

The original exception details are written to the log files. The
UUID can be used to reference the individual 500 error in the log.

commit_message:
Change server exceptions to show less details

Internal exceptions were dumping error messages raised by
arbitrary python calls and potentially revealing sensitive
details.

The message for all 500 errors is now::

    Internal Server Error. (<UUID>)

The original exception details are written to the log files. The
UUID can be used to reference the individual 500 error in the log.

Change-Id: I57e13a182fd868a1f45419b51d08fe744d650e5f
Fixes: bug #1189673

commit_message:
Increase to 255 the length of the user name.

This change is needed by [1]. This won't change the results of the test
right now, since keystone rejects usernames longer than 64 and 255 > 64.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/22694/

Change-Id: Iaf81b223cd8f0ec41b9836e26a4c294c10d56893

commit_message:
Fixes re-auth flow with expired tokens.

The re-authentication of expired tokens assumed that the 401 would
always occur on the first HTTP at tempt. This fix changes that so that
re-auth is still only attempted once, but no longer has to be on the
first attempt.

Change-Id: I93a1187da3637287a803a59c146256d4f543c9d5
Fixes: bug #1131142

commit_message:
Fixes re-auth flow with expired tokens.

The re-authentication of expired tokens assumed that the 401 would always occur on the first HTTP attempt. This fix changes that so that re-auth is still only attempted once, but no longer has to be on the first attempt.
Fixes: bug #1131142

Change-Id: I196079c558d89bd4c94bb7d5391796fb263db871

The code appears to do what it says on the tin, but...

Is there any way this can be achieved with explicit dependencies? (i.e. FloatingIP takes a RouterGateway reference instead of a floating_network_id)

As it stands, this doesn't solve the case where e.g. the user wants to create the RouterGateway manually _after_ creating the template. They should be required to pass the RouterGateway ID in to ensure they create it first, even if they're doing it outside of a template."}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-05-29 06:03:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Zane, the resource could require the RouterGateway ID instead of the floating_network_id, but then it would no longer be a thin wrapper over the quantum API.

Native resources probably shouldn't be fixing shortcomings in the APIs they wrap."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-06-05 04:01:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

commit_message:
Add dependency between FloatingIP and RouterGateway

When a template has a FloatingIP and a RouterGateway on the same
external network, there is an implicit dependency on create where
the gateway must be created before the floating ip.

This is implemented by overiding add_dependencies in FloatingIP
and looking in the stack for RouterGateway resource to depend on.

Fixed bug: #1182266

Change-Id: I40f281e5bf2a27280d328fe11d32e6404f412a79

I didn't have a big problem with passing the files into the stack, but having them in the Template object does actually make a lot of sense to me.

What I would like to see in the near future is that the files get stored in the database, rather than lost after the stack create. This code should work fine for provider templates, since they get stored as their own stack objects, but not for the generic case that is hopefully coming."}, {'account_id': 4328, 'date': '2013-06-19 15:16:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-19 15:06:04.000000000', 'message': 'Fix memcache encryption middleware

This fixes lp1175367 and lp1175368 by redesigning the memcache crypt
middleware to not do dangerous things. It is forward compatible, but
will invalidate any existing ephemeral encrypted or signed memcache
entries.

Change-Id: Ice8724949a48bfad3b8b7c41b5f50a18a9ad9f42
Signed-off-by: Bryan D. Payne <bdpayne@acm.org>
'}]
commit_message:
Fix memcache encryption middleware

This fixes lp1175367 and lp1175368 by redesigning the memcache crypt
middleware to not do dangerous things. It is forward compatible, but
will invalidate any existing ephemeral encrypted or signed memcache
entries.

Change-Id: Ice8724949a48bfad3b8b7c41b5f50a18a9ad9f42
Signed-off-by: Bryan D. Payne <bdpayne@acm.org>

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-19 01:59:39.000000000', 'message': "Use heat-manage to sync heat db.

heat-db-setup has been deprecated and doesn't work when
devstack uses postgres and mysql isn't installed.

This is causing postgres gating to fail for heat.

Change-Id: I84f0a2d40f0033e52c87b6f0c9c7265471134ffe
"}]
commit_message:
Use heat-manage to sync heat db.

heat-db-setup has been deprecated and doesn't work when
devstack uses postgres and mysql isn't installed.

This is causing postgres gating to fail for heat.

Change-Id: I84f0a2d40f0033e52c87b6f0c9c7265471134ffe

[{'created': '2013-06-17 20:24:20.000000000', 'message': "Set default 'ou' name for LDAP projects to Projects

The default ou name for projects/tenants should be Projects, as we normally
use in devstack and ldap live test. Since multiple LDAP objects can
use groupOfNames, setting projects group to Groups is vague.

Fixes Bug1191807

Change-Id: I1718c76320da51a58abf6558a9b8560e908773cb
"}]
commit_message:
Set default 'ou' name for LDAP projects to Projects

The default ou name for projects/tenants should be Projects, as we normally
use in devstack and ldap live test. Since multiple LDAP objects can
use groupOfNames, setting projects group to Groups is vague.

Fixes Bug1191807

Change-Id: I1718c76320da51a58abf6558a9b8560e908773cb

commit_message:
Remove the unused plugin framework

This framework is used by Nova to allow adding API extensions and
notification drivers. Ironic doesn't use the code at all.

Change-Id: I09e4f14a65b162d5d0571da0b724d0f8a8f11646

commit_message:
Fix TestNecAgentMain not to call sys.exit()

test_main() was calling sys.exit() killing test running
and not allowing tests to complete in a proper way.

Drop explicit sys.exit() call from net agent's main() and
fix outdated mocks in test_main().

Fixes bug #1192270

Change-Id: Iea8d5508f73eb9144e452de3305f2dec4c2a319c

commit_message:
Fix `set_defaults()` function.

If we change `control_exchange` option using `set_defaults()` function
it has no effect in some cases.
Function `cfg.set_defaults()` was replaced to `cfg.CONF.set_default()`
to fix it.

Fixes bug 1189759

Change-Id: Ia603bd4f1b6bf7326a90cae60c25a9b5e4079575

commit_message:
Use Python 3.x compatible except construct

Use except x as y:, which works with any
Python version >= 2.6

Change-Id: Ibf0f9aa8fb9725c1c9c00558ec217db96301678f

[{'created': '2013-06-19 13:36:27.000000000', 'message': "Reference default_servicetype group in lowercase

Now that we require oslo-config-1.2.0, we can start referencing group
names as lowercase. Let's start with the default_servicetype group.

We do this simply by changing the case of the group name passed to
register_opt():

  -cfg.CONF.register_opts(..., 'DEFAULT_SERVICETYPE')
  +cfg.CONF.register_opts(..., 'default_servicetype')

and this means that all options in the group now need to be referenced
using the lowercase group name i.e.

  -svc_defs = cfg.CONF.DEFAULT_SERVICETYPE.service_definition
  +svc_defs = cfg.CONF.default_servicetype.service_definition

Note however, users can still use the uppercase section name for
backwards compatibility.

When we last attempted to do this, oslo.config-1.2.0 wasn't actually
being installed correctly so add a unit test which verifies that both
uppercase and lowercase section names work.

Change-Id: I9357397f39d8f7d0d4f445b78aae5665c7ece3d4

commit_message:
Reference default_servicetype group in lowercase

Now that we require oslo-config-1.2.0, we can start referencing group
names as lowercase. Let's start with the default_servicetype group.

We do this simply by changing the case of the group name passed to
register_opt():

  -cfg.CONF.register_opts(..., 'DEFAULT_SERVICETYPE')
  +cfg.CONF.register_opts(..., 'default_servicetype')

and this means that all options in the group now need to be referenced
using the lowercase group name i.e.

  -svc_defs = cfg.CONF.DEFAULT_SERVICETYPE.service_definition
  +svc_defs = cfg.CONF.default_servicetype.service_definition

Note however, users can still use the uppercase section name for
backwards compatibility.

When we last attempted to do this, oslo.config-1.2.0 wasn't actually
being installed correctly so add a unit test which verifies that both
uppercase and lowercase section names work.

Change-Id: I9357397f39d8f7d0d4f445b78aae5665c7ece3d4

Delete openstack-ops from openstack-manuals repo

The Operations Guide has its own repository now.
New repository is https://github.com/openstack/operations-guide

Fixes bug 1180552

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-11 00:56:40.000000000', 'message': 'Restrict jsonschema to <2 for now

blueprint nova-api-validation-fw(Ieba96718264ad2ddfba63b65425f7e5bbb8606a9)
uses internal functions of jsonschema>=1.0.0,<2. These functions has been
changed since jsonschema 2.0.0.

Current JSON-Schema specification is draft-4, and it will be changed in
the future. So for now, this patch restricts jsonschema <2.
When full JSON-Schema specification will be implemented or we need more the
features of the latest jsonschema library, this restrictions must be changed.

Change-Id: I20c77f20cf26b19cd7293a4315d9ffda6b8b45e5
'}]
commit_message:
Restrict jsonschema to <2 for now

blueprint nova-api-validation-fw(Ieba96718264ad2ddfba63b65425f7e5bbb8606a9)
uses internal functions of jsonschema>=1.0.0,<2. These functions has been
changed since jsonschema 2.0.0.

Current JSON-Schema specification is draft-4, and it will be changed in
the future. So for now, this patch restricts jsonschema <2.
When full JSON-Schema specification will be implemented or we need more the
features of the latest jsonschema library, this restrictions must be changed.

Change-Id: I20c77f20cf26b19cd7293a4315d9ffda6b8b45e5

Change-Id: Ie8676c23de5a62d3b8b2b4088b67d249ae90ceef

commit_message:
Detect failed instance creation in autoscaling

Wait for instances to be created sucessfully before adding them to the
list in the Autoscaling resource.

Fixes: bug #1192125
Change-Id: Ie8676c23de5a62d3b8b2b4088b67d249ae90ceef

commit_message:
Enforce reverse time-order for sample return

Implements: blueprint api-sample-sorted

Added a new test test_get_samples_in_default_order() for class RawSampleTest in
tests/storage/base.py to check that the samples are sorted by timestamp, from
newest to oldest, e.g. first sample is newest

Added more samples to the test database in tests/storage/base.py , to make
testing of time ordering more robust, and appropriately changed tests to match
the expected results from the new modified test database.

Added code to sort samples in reverse time order, in get_samples() of
ceilometer/storage/impl_mongodb.py and ceilometer/storage/impl_sqlalchemy.py

Change-Id: Ib822bbbfc8fd47cf6685926762295577b69fd417

commit_message:
Implement a new test case for volume cloning functionality

A test is added for the volume cloning functionality (we didn't
have any). Also fixes an issue in base class where we want the
volume IDs to be added as soon as possible into the creation list,
to make sure the cleanup deletes volumes in error state too.

Change-Id: I624ddbf80a2000987c58ea3baa8db96ab9cfde6f
Fixes: bug #1191804

commit_message:
add support in devstack to run it with cisco plugin

implements blueprint cisco-plugin-support

Change-Id: Ib4716c9ef6daa059d5210631d927253bf2ba6a64

'}, {'account_id': 2976, 'date': '2013-05-24 12:28:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2013-05-24 15:50:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Do not merge

(1 inline comment)

I'd put the cleanup code in _clean_volume_group() as it also needs to run on the second vg (VOLUME_GROUP2).

Also, moving the setting of VOLUME_BACKING_FILE and VOLUME_BACKING_FILE2 out of create_cinder_volume_group() and to the top next to VOLUME_GROUP would make the names available everywhere"}, {'account_id': 7350, 'date': '2013-05-24 16:35:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 2976, 'date': '2013-05-24 17:17:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-05-24 17:27:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/30227/3/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-full/18370 : SUCCESS in 48m 28s
- http://logs.openstack.org/30227/3/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-postgres-full/18080 : FAILURE in 51m 08s (non-voting)
- http://logs.openstack.org/30227/3/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-quantum/25143 : SUCCESS in 20m 43s
- http://logs.openstack.org/30227/3/check/gate-grenade-devstack-vm/5825 : FAILURE in 17m 12s (non-voting)
'}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2013-05-24 17:41:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

The point of moving the name setting was to reuse it in the cleanup code.

When will _clean_lvm_backing_file() be called apart from _clean_lvm_group()?  I don't see the need for two functions here."}, {'account_id': 7350, 'date': '2013-05-24 21:08:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

I didn't want to rename the function "_clean_volume_group". And I couldn't put the lvm cleaning code inside this function because the function would have done more than just cleaning the volume group.

Plus I prefer to have small functions (max 10 lines) so having 2 functions seemed to be the better option.

And you never know, maybe one day one of the 2 functions will be called individually :)'}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2013-05-29 15:34:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: (4 inline comments)

[I thought I'd posted this earlier...]

Don't worry about requirements that do not exist yet, keep things simple, and in this case I think one function is simpler than two since they are closely related."}, {'account_id': 7350, 'date': '2013-06-04 09:22:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 7350, 'date': '2013-06-04 09:48:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

I think vgremove/pvremove is not mandatory. I have done a lot of stack/unstack without it and my lvm is still in good shape. I believe each time you issue an lv* command the list of physical volume and volume group is rescanned and as the backing device is gone, LVM "understands" and doesnt complain.

There's still is "losetup -d" in clean.sh because the initial logic in clean.sh is to delete the loop device unconditionnaly whereas in lib/cinder, the loop device is deleted only if there is no LV left.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-06-04 10:16:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Works for me

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-18 18:44:28.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "Delegate authentication to quantumclient"

This reverts commit dd9c27f999221001bae9faa03571645824d2a681.

When this patch was merged, we were suspicious about whether it was safe
to cache the client object and have it used by multiple greenthreads.
We decided it was safe and merged it.  After thinking about it and
discussing it further, it is really a bad idea.  Sharing httplib2
connections is not considered thread-safe.

quantumclient.client.HTTPClient inherits from httplib2.Http.  The
following page says sharing instances of this object between threads is
not safe:

  https://developers.google.com/api-client-library/python/guide/thread_safety

  "The google-api-python-client library is built on top of the httplib2
  library, which is not thread-safe. Therefore, if you are running as a
  multi-threaded application, each thread that you are making requests
  from must have its own instance of httplib2.Http()."

Potentially fix bug 1192131.  Even if it doesn't fix that bug, this
needs to be reverted anyway.

Change-Id: I2e4bf5e7b6458cd7b76e30847fe07f06b25c34f7
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Delegate authentication to quantumclient"

This reverts commit dd9c27f999221001bae9faa03571645824d2a681.

When this patch was merged, we were suspicious about whether it was safe
to cache the client object and have it used by multiple greenthreads.
We decided it was safe and merged it.  After thinking about it and
discussing it further, it is really a bad idea.  Sharing httplib2
connections is not considered thread-safe.

quantumclient.client.HTTPClient inherits from httplib2.Http.  The
following page says sharing instances of this object between threads is
not safe:

  https://developers.google.com/api-client-library/python/guide/thread_safety

  "The google-api-python-client library is built on top of the httplib2
  library, which is not thread-safe. Therefore, if you are running as a
  multi-threaded application, each thread that you are making requests
  from must have its own instance of httplib2.Http()."

Potentially fix bug 1192131.  Even if it doesn't fix that bug, this
needs to be reverted anyway.

Change-Id: I2e4bf5e7b6458cd7b76e30847fe07f06b25c34f7

[{'created': '2013-06-12 14:28:40.000000000', 'message': 'Check libvirt version earlier

Running libvirt 0.8 causes an exception to be thrown before
has_min_version() is run, resulting in no error message about version
being logged.  This change moves the version check before the libvirt
calls are made.

Change-Id: Ifaae18c6686d72fb79fc32081c4087084ae8bbb9
Fixes: bug #1190232
'}]
commit_message:
Check libvirt version earlier

Running libvirt 0.8 causes an exception to be thrown before
has_min_version() is run, resulting in no error message about version
being logged.  This change moves the version check before the libvirt
calls are made.

Change-Id: Ifaae18c6686d72fb79fc32081c4087084ae8bbb9
Fixes: bug #1190232

commit_message:
scheduler: Simplify DependencyTaskGroup interface

Instead of passing a function that takes one argument and returns a task
that takes no arguments, simply pass a task that takes one argument.

Change-Id: I73d5f137d5db492c09e6887f80e7e759734c211f

commit_message:
Vanilla plugin configuration helper fixing:

* Added hidden configs, which could not be changed by user
* Fixes issue with generating xml document with only text nodes

Improves blueprint vanilla-plugin-configs-improvements

Change-Id: Idd1f58e65fd68bcd197fa40618ebff94a1c8f24f

[{'created': '2013-06-10 20:29:56.000000000', 'message': 'Implement capability to extend existing volume.

This patch adds the core components to implement extending
the size of an existing available volume.

Volume status must be available, and the format is:
    extend <vol-id> <new-size>

	where new-size must be > current size.

Adding support to drivers will be handled in follow up
patches for each of the existing drivers.

Implements blueprint: volume-resize

Change-Id: I40026083e564ea2074757e11e13cd07cdae3e6cc

commit_message:
Implement capability to extend existing volume.

This patch adds the core components to implement extending
the size of an existing available volume.

Volume status must be available, and the format is:
    extend <vol-id> <new-size>

where new-size must be > current size.

Adding support to drivers will be handled in follow up
patches for each of the existing drivers.

Implements blueprint: volume-resize

Change-Id: I40026083e564ea2074757e11e13cd07cdae3e6cc

commit_message:
Implement scheduler hints for APIv2

We've done this implementation because we need to use scheduler hint in
cinder with some specific filters. So, most part of code have been
imported from nova.

bp scheduler-hints
docimpact

Change-Id: Ib7e858e98110a30c5f8d5ff05d03ce2d61f04f92

@Peter Portante:  Thanks, test has been fixed.'}, {'account_id': 1216, 'date': '2013-06-03 13:27:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(5 inline comments)

I got kind of confused with this one quickly. It may be that we're trying to shove too much into one setting with local_region_affinity. Perhaps making two settings? local_nodes_only=True|False and local_nodes_first=True|False

I'm not sure, but it is very confusing to me in this state."}, {'account_id': 6577, 'date': '2013-06-03 15:37:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: (5 inline comments)

@gholt: I agree with your idea. But we use only 3 state for 'local_region_affinity'. If replacing this option by 2 other parameters is seemed better, I will do it. Thanks)"}, {'account_id': 1216, 'date': '2013-06-04 13:56:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

I'll wait for others to weigh in. It's confusing to me, but maybe it's just me."}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2013-06-07 01:01:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I, too, find myself sort of confused by some of what's in here.

So, iter_nodes() now takes a parameter called local_region_affinity, and to actually use it, you have to call iter_nodes(..., local_region_affinity=False). So, False means "on", I guess?

And it looks like calling iter_nodes() with local_region_affinity=False will cause you to get the first 3 nodes that are in the configured region, and the one guy that does that is GETorHEAD_base, so only local-region nodes are then used for GET/HEAD requests... what good is that? The data's on the primary nodes, regardless of what region they're in. I don't see how it's a good idea to look where the data isn't, no matter how fast the looking may be.'}, {'account_id': 917, 'date': '2013-06-12 15:26:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Do not merge

This shouldn't be merged since the other local read affinity patch got merged"}, {'account_id': 6198, 'date': '2013-06-13 21:41:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Let's get this merged with this dependent write affinity patch, and then merged up with Sam Merrit's read affinity patches and then we can reevaluate it."}, {'account_id': 6577, 'date': '2013-06-19 07:44:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Abandoned

This functional is implemented yet.'}]

commit_message:
Proxy affinity for reading.

* Configurable parameter region was added in proxy-server
  configuration file.
* New configurable algorithm for iter_nodes function generate nodes
  according to following variants:
    - only local nodes;
    - local nodes and then remote nodes;
    - default behavior.
* Using configurable iter_nodes for some requests according to proxy
  affinity implementation.

Change-Id: Iedb7a516d7392c5705b92dcb60ca84602aaa95ee
Implements: blueprint proxy-affinity
Implements: blueprint multi-region

- http://logs.openstack.org/33417/1/check/gate-nova-pylint/14041 : SUCCESS in 12m 35s (non-voting)
'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2013-06-18 13:50:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Do not merge

I didn't just strip out your test because it was very broken and blocking the gate. I also made it work like all the other conductor tests, which just test the api(s).

Conductor (in this case) is just a conduit, so please put the functional tests somewhere else if they're not already present."}, {'account_id': 6969, 'date': '2013-06-18 14:25:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I realise the test was blocking the gate, and my change will not do so. I learned from your change and this is not an issue now.

But if you look at the implementation of the volume_usage_update it is not just a conduit to the db layer, maybe the code should be in the db layer, but it is not currently. test_volume_usage_update should test this method as it stands and I don't want to lose any coverage on this as I have already had one major bug over this issue that I don't want to lose coverage on that."}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2013-06-18 14:38:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Your changes here are testing notifier, not conductor. My respin of your test ensures that notifier gets called as expected, which is all that should be done in a conductor test, IMHO. If you think notifier is not properly tested in some way, then you should add tests elsewhere for that.'}, {'account_id': 6969, 'date': '2013-06-18 14:59:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

The tests actually test that compute_utils.usage_volume_info works with the vol_usage object from sqlalchemy that is returned from the db layer which happens here in the conductor. This is to test a bug I had with the conductor. See https://review.openstack.org/#/c/31957/

In my case the compute_utils worked, db.vol_usage_update worked as expected but the vol_usage_update in the conductor failed to combine the two on the second time through.

To my eyes the unit test here is testing vol_usage_update as a unit. That includes the db layer which is included in this. mocking out the db call just hides that problem. 

Maybe the other methods should be stronger and it should be else where but there is no "nice" place to put them at the moment without some thinking and work.'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2013-06-18 15:32:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

The existing test 100% covers the code in conductor (with the exception of db.get_session(), which seems completely inappropriate at first glance). If you look at the other tests in test_conductor, they're simply making sure that all the conductor layers stack together properly.

If there is an issue with sqlalchemy models making it out of db/api and triggering some weird behavior across conductor, that is best placed in tests/compute somewhere, I'd guess.

I'm going to stop arguing with you, but I still assert that this patch doesn't really add anything of value to the tests, and if it does, it doesn't belong in test_conductor. Until I see some really compelling reason to the contrary (having to think is a not good enough excuse, IMHO), I'm still at -2.

Thanks!"}, {'account_id': 6969, 'date': '2013-06-18 16:42:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Fine, it just solved a real problem for me.

Giving up too'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2013-06-18 18:18:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

No, it tested a bad hack for the real issue. Please see the following and then abandon this change:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/33474/

Thanks!'}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2013-06-19 00:27:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Do not merge

Agree with Dan.  We should not be exposing the sqlalchemy session from db/api.py.. and the real problem is with the sqlalchemy db method implementation not refreshing the data before returning.  The correct fix is Dan's patch that he linked."}, {'account_id': 6969, 'date': '2013-06-19 07:32:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-18 09:23:06.000000000', 'message': 'Fix overzealous removal of conductor test for vol_usage_update

Changeset I815b25f6585786a8dbd5eefcfb39e2b4790641cb fixed an issue with a unit
test overuse of the mox library and general over specification. But it went
to far the other way makes the test useless to me as the original author of the
test and who has done a lot of work on volume usage.

The main thing that this test tests, is that db.vol_usage_update returns a
sqlalachmy instance object and accessing attributes on this object can trigger
more SQL queries to the database. This is turn can break the volume usage
poll and cause the notification of volume usage events to stop. This was the
problem that changeset Id3216caa482110bdec2b7f5ea13050112e4da009 solved and
where the tests originated.

The patch should not impact the tests like it used to but will keep up the
same level of coverage as the old tests.

Change-Id: I07db9b40e6fda0af288dc31ec5585b99682652ea
'}]
commit_message:
Fix overzealous removal of conductor test for vol_usage_update

Changeset I815b25f6585786a8dbd5eefcfb39e2b4790641cb fixed an issue with a unit
test overuse of the mox library and general over specification. But it went
to far the other way makes the test useless to me as the original author of the
test and who has done a lot of work on volume usage.

The main thing that this test tests, is that db.vol_usage_update returns a
sqlalachmy instance object and accessing attributes on this object can trigger
more SQL queries to the database. This is turn can break the volume usage
poll and cause the notification of volume usage events to stop. This was the
problem that changeset Id3216caa482110bdec2b7f5ea13050112e4da009 solved and
where the tests originated.

The patch should not impact the tests like it used to but will keep up the
same level of coverage as the old tests.

Change-Id: I07db9b40e6fda0af288dc31ec5585b99682652ea

Mitchell', 'email': 'klmitch@mit.edu', 'username': 'klmitch'}, {'_account_id': 1561, 'name': 'Russell Bryant', 'email': 'rbryant@redhat.com', 'username': 'russellb'}, {'_account_id': 2166, 'name': 'SmokeStack CI', 'username': 'smokestack', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 5174, 'name': 'Mauro Rodrigues', 'email': 'maurosr@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'maurosr'}, {'_account_id': 5292, 'name': 'Christopher Yeoh', 'email': 'cbkyeoh@gmail.com', 'username': 'cyeoh-0'}, {'_account_id': 5652, 'name': 'David Ripton', 'email': 'dripton@redhat.com', 'username': 'dripton'}, {'_account_id': 7219, 'name': 'git-harry', 'email': 'git-harry@live.co.uk', 'username': 'git-harry'}, {'_account_id': 7369, 'name': 'Sergey Skripnick', 'email': 'sskripnick@mirantis.com', 'username': 'redixin'}, {'_account_id': 7802, 'name': 'Teran McKinney', 'email': 'teran.mckinney@rackspace.com', 'username': 'teran-mckinney'}]

'}, {'account_id': 177, 'date': '2013-05-14 16:05:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I'm not sure this fixes the linked bug. It doesn't seem to affect the example given."}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2013-05-15 19:14:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

I'm not convinced this fixes the linked bug, either; it seems to me that the bulk of the change actually just changes where in the processing the 400 gets generated…"}, {'account_id': 7219, 'date': '2013-05-16 12:09:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I have tested this on devstack with and without the patch and it works for me.

Current behaviour:

1) $ curl http://95.138.165.66:8774/v2/a5e67e6e4cb3452894c2c3a543fba003/servers/detail -X GET -H "X-Auth-Project-Id: demo" -H "User-Agent: python-novaclient" -H "Accept: application/json" -H "X-Auth-Token: $auth_token"
{"servers": []}

2) $ curl http://95.138.165.66:8774/v2/a5e67e6e4cb3452894c2c3a543fba003/servers/detail -X GET -H "X-Auth-Project-Id: demo" -H "User-Agent: python-novaclient" -H "Accept: application/json" -H "X-Auth-Token: $auth_token" -d "{}"
{"servers": []}

3) $ curl http://95.138.165.66:8774/v2/a5e67e6e4cb3452894c2c3a543fba003/servers/detail -X GET -H "X-Auth-Project-Id: demo" -H "User-Agent: python-novaclient" -H "Accept: application/json" -H "X-Auth-Token: $auth_token" -H "Content-Type: " -d "{}"
{"servers": []}

4) $ curl http://95.138.165.66:8774/v2/a5e67e6e4cb3452894c2c3a543fba003/servers/detail -X GET -H "X-Auth-Project-Id: demo" -H "User-Agent: python-novaclient" -H "Accept: application/json" -H "X-Auth-Token: $auth_token" -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d "{}"
{"badRequest": {"message": "The server could not comply with the request since it is either malformed or otherwise incorrect.", "code": 400}}


With patch applied:

1) $ curl http://95.138.165.66:8774/v2/dd554241f6c84756976c89d87fe49ad8/servers/detail -X GET -H "X-Auth-Project-Id: demo" -H "User-Agent: python-novaclient" -H "Accept: application/json" -H "X-Auth-Token: $auth_token"{"servers": []}

2) $ curl http://95.138.165.66:8774/v2/dd554241f6c84756976c89d87fe49ad8/servers/detail -X GET -H "X-Auth-Project-Id: demo" -H "User-Agent: python-novaclient" -H "Accept: application/json" -H "X-Auth-Token: $auth_token"  -d "{}"{"badRequest": {"message": "Unrecognized Content-Type provided in request", "code": 400}}

3) $ curl http://95.138.165.66:8774/v2/dd554241f6c84756976c89d87fe49ad8/servers/detail -X GET -H "X-Auth-Project-Id: demo" -H "User-Agent: python-novaclient" -H "Accept: application/json" -H "X-Auth-Token: $auth_token" -H "Content-Type: " -d "{}"{"badRequest": {"message": "No Content-Type provided in request", "code": 400}}

4) $ curl http://95.138.165.66:8774/v2/dd554241f6c84756976c89d87fe49ad8/servers/detail -X GET -H "X-Auth-Project-Id: demo" -H "User-Agent: python-novaclient" -H "Accept: application/json" -H "X-Auth-Token: $auth_token" -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d "{}"{"badRequest": {"message": "The server could not comply with the request since it is either malformed or otherwise incorrect.", "code": 400}}


1) shows the behaviour of a correctly formatted request, the response is the same for both requests
2) (this is the example given in the initial bug) curl sends an unrecognised content-type, 400 returned
3) no content-type now raises a 400 error
4) this doesn't change'}, {'account_id': 177, 'date': '2013-05-16 13:50:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Weird that's what thought I tried. I'll give it another shot :)"}, {'account_id': 177, 'date': '2013-05-17 14:04:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I think we may want to change the responses a bit. The real issue here is that no HTTP GET in nova uses or expects a request body. So we should say that to the user instead of dealing with content-type since it shouldn't matter anyways since there shouldn't be a body."}, {'account_id': 7219, 'date': '2013-05-24 12:51:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

The reason I chose to deal with this indirectly, via the content-type, was so that any error relating to specific requirements for an API call , e.g. a GET request receiving an unwanted message body, would be handled by the method responsible for responding to the request.

This allows the correct response to be returned but does have the side-effect that a request GET request with a message body but no content-type gets an error for having no content-type and not for having a message body.

I will upload an alternative patch for review to deal with the issue directly.'}, {'account_id': 7219, 'date': '2013-05-24 12:56:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-05-24 13:42:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

I suggest we split this into two:
rename the element, and the local paths, which will mean we stop adding technical debt. Add a try-and-fail to use the new URL, fallback to old url code path.

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-18 22:52:01.000000000', 'message': "Update attach status when instance id invalid.

In cinder.manager do_attach we have a check to make sure the
supplied instance id is a valid UUID which is great, but if it's
not we just raise and dump out, leaving the volume in an attaching
state.

We should update the status to error_attaching in this case and then
raise/return.

Fixes bug: 1192370

Change-Id: Ia759ea7a387544913953ca84e9ed927480c4edfd
"}]
commit_message:
Update attach status when instance id invalid.

In cinder.manager do_attach we have a check to make sure the
supplied instance id is a valid UUID which is great, but if it's
not we just raise and dump out, leaving the volume in an attaching
state.

We should update the status to error_attaching in this case and then
raise/return.

Fixes bug: 1192370

Change-Id: Ia759ea7a387544913953ca84e9ed927480c4edfd

commit_message:
Adds cold migrate call in conductor

This is the first step to move cold migration to conductor.
It changes compute.api to call conductor for migration and let
conductor coordinate the rest. Conductor calls scheduler to request
the destination host and then it calls compute.rpcapi.prep_resize to
do the cold migration task. Next patch will move the code out of the
compute.manager and all the logic will be in conductor.

Partially implements bp cold-migrations-to-conductor

Change-Id: I012592eb01176a137d766f0c3b3ce0bddd87b264

commit_message:
remote user as plugin

Blueprint pluggable-remote-user

Changes the pipeline contract.  Now each pipeline component is always run, but has the potential to "opt out" if it does not have sufficient reason to run.

Change-Id: Iccb0459ca1c0da257c3b30dd401727b739728915

commit_message:
Add missing tests for certificate_* methods

There was no tests in test_db_api for certificate_*
methods.

Add tests to ensure that all works.

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-12 19:02:39.000000000', 'message': 'Don't overspecify successful status codes.

In HTTP, any 2xx status code indicates success. There were a number of
places in the documentation where a particular status code (e.g. 204
No Content) was specified as the only successful status code for a
particular request. That's overly-specific, and in some cases, wrong.

For example, consider a request like:

    GET /v1/account/container/object HTTP/1.1
    Range: bytes=20-50

The documentation before this change said that a 200 would be
returned. However, if the Range header is used, then the response may
have a 206 (Partial Content) status code instead.

There are other cases too, say 200 vs. 204, where either one works.

In general, Swift doesn't specify a particular response code for
successful responses; since Swift provides an HTTP API, it relies on
the HTTP standard to define "successful".

Change-Id: Ie21bcec491453f0371e4b84257aae4c30e342fb3
'}]
commit_message:
Don't overspecify successful status codes.

In HTTP, any 2xx status code indicates success. There were a number of
places in the documentation where a particular status code (e.g. 204
No Content) was specified as the only successful status code for a
particular request. That's overly-specific, and in some cases, wrong.

For example, consider a request like:

    GET /v1/account/container/object HTTP/1.1
    Range: bytes=20-50

The documentation before this change said that a 200 would be
returned. However, if the Range header is used, then the response may
have a 206 (Partial Content) status code instead.

There are other cases too, say 200 vs. 204, where either one works.

In general, Swift doesn't specify a particular response code for
successful responses; since Swift provides an HTTP API, it relies on
the HTTP standard to define "successful".

Change-Id: Ie21bcec491453f0371e4b84257aae4c30e342fb3

This commit message is not very descriptive, it says that it "updates README.md with a more complete set of documentation", but it removes more documentation that it adds without any context in the commit message as to why the documentation was removed.

Also, as before, what is the motivation for moving the examples from tests to examples? This breaks the swift tests that run as a part of the dev_env.'}, {'account_id': 7423, 'date': '2013-06-07 22:37:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

examples -> tests is to keep in line with the Style Guide, http://docs.puppetlabs.com/guides/style_guide.html#tests. I also view that site.pp manifests delivered in the module to still fall under the "tests" concept.

In this case I specifically am on the opinion that documentation on storeconfigs and pluginsync is out of scope of this document.  I'll add back the proxy and test script section.'}, {'account_id': 2265, 'date': '2013-06-07 22:48:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

I initially made the decision to put the example manifests in the examples directory and not the tests directory b/c I felt they were not used for any kind of testing. I am a little bit unclear if that particular style recommendation is still valid b/c it was conceived before there was any standard for testing module (ie: rspec-puppet). It was also unclear as to rather or not any convention is expected from things in the tests directory (ie: are things expected to test them, do they have some specific purpose). I wanted to keep examples in the examples directory so as to not violate any expectations about things in the tests directory.'}, {'account_id': 2265, 'date': '2013-06-07 22:50:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

as a potential compromise, I could agree to entirely removing (as long as no one else objects) the examples directory. I do not think they have been properly maintained to stay in line with the manifests as they change anyways.'}, {'account_id': 7423, 'date': '2013-06-07 23:45:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

My hope would be that we keep the examples and actually treat them like tests.  Forces our hand to keep  them up to date.'}, {'account_id': 2265, 'date': '2013-06-07 23:46:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

what will they be testing? Is the intention to run them as a part of a CI process?'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-06-15 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Abandoned

commit_message:
Prepare repository for a Puppet Forge release

  Commit updates README.md with a consistent template for documentation,
  removes travis.yml since we're on stackfoge now, updates the
  Modulefile for release, removes CHANGELOG in favor of summarized release
  notes in the README that will be viewable on Forge for the new
  release, and moves examples to tests to adhere to Puppet Labs Style
  Guide (http://docs.puppetlabs.com/guides/style_guide.html#tests).

Change-Id: Ic7e672eb6240b0acce7384706aa79b430bd2b003

commit_message:
Support cloud-specific suffixes to server status.

Some clouds, *cough*HP*cough* append extra data to their
status strings. Such as: BUILD(scheduling) or BUILD(networking).
We don't really want to be on the hook for keeping a list of those,
but if we just grab the bit in front of the parenthetical, we should
be able to tell state sensibly, even when people are being weird.

Change-Id: Idaf079d6090db50c9041f398a257b427d63ff48d

commit_message:
Manually mock service_catalog in stub_keystoneclient

MockObject.__init__ ignores properties, fixes:

FAIL: test_get_default_role (openstack_dashboard.test.api_tests.keystone_tests.RoleAPITests)
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/var/lib/openstack-dashboard-test/openstack_dashboard/test/api_tests/keystone_tests.py", line 78, in test_get_default_role
    keystoneclient = self.stub_keystoneclient()
  File "/var/lib/openstack-dashboard-test/openstack_dashboard/test/helpers.py", line 287, in stub_keystoneclient
    self.keystoneclient = self.mox.CreateMock(keystone_client.Client)
  File "/usr/lib64/python2.6/site-packages/mox.py", line 258, in CreateMock
    new_mock = MockObject(class_to_mock, attrs=attrs)
  File "/usr/lib64/python2.6/site-packages/mox.py", line 556, in __init__
    attr = getattr(class_to_mock, method)
  File "/usr/lib64/python2.6/site-packages/mox.py", line 608, in __getattr__
    raise UnknownMethodCallError(name)
UnknownMethodCallError: Method called is not a member of the object: service_catalog
>>  raise UnknownMethodCallError('service_catalog')

Change-Id: I0af2f571855ad63c204e26d8283a713be0caae8f

commit_message:
Update to the latest stevedore

Use a version of stevedore that does not try to
install distribute.

The requirements change is in
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/32738/

Change-Id: I277a282ed86743a25138c431045af1f0ccb11b39
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug.hellmann@dreamhost.com>

commit_message:
API support for Environments

Support "Environment" section in the create/update body.
We the roll up the parameters and the environment and send
that as json using the rpc "params" argument. So no changes
to the rpc layer are needed. The engine knows how to deal
with both formats in the Environments class.

blueprint envirnonments
Change-Id: I6d6085d5c052a5f9115ecd46891b00d2fad4d1db

Use the Environment from within the engine

at this point the concept only exists in the engine, the
api and client changes will come in later patches.

'}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2013-05-14 22:59:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

As far as I know, directory-marker objects are completely useless. Is it good enough to just delete them instead of adding code to staticweb to work around their presence?'}, {'account_id': 1160, 'date': '2013-05-15 13:06:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I agree they're of questionable use, but the Swift docs cover them in detail (http://docs.openstack.org/trunk/openstack-object-storage/developer/content/pseudo-hierarchical-folders-directories.html) and I know of at least two clients that create them."}, {'account_id': 1160, 'date': '2013-05-15 13:51:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Make that three - the swift CLI creates them too.'}, {'account_id': 2696, 'date': '2013-05-17 04:13:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

Seems reasonable to me...'}, {'account_id': 597, 'date': '2013-05-21 20:47:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Seems ok for what it is.'}, {'account_id': 1216, 'date': '2013-05-22 19:02:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

The idea seems sound to me but the implementation should check for a zero byte content length as well. Otherwise, this will 404 any file with actual content just because its content type happens to end with /directory"}, {'account_id': 2828, 'date': '2013-05-22 19:32:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I use "application/directory" objects in cloudfuse to implement mkdir.  There isn't really some better way to model an empty directory that I know of.

Cyberduck used to upload objects of type "application/folder", and it'd put some contents in the object that were just like.. "FOLDER" or "CYBERDUCK" or something.  I haven't looked in a while to see if it still does that part.  I know they switched to using delimiter a long time ago.'}, {'account_id': 1160, 'date': '2013-05-22 20:35:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 1160, 'date': '2013-05-22 20:37:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

According to http://docs.openstack.org/trunk/openstack-object-storage/developer/content/pseudo-hierarchical-folders-directories.html directory marker objects can be 0 or 1-byte files, so I'm checking for a content-length <= 1."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-05-22 21:19:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Doesn't seem to work

Build failed.  For information on how to proceed, see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GerritJenkinsGithub#Test_Failures

- http://logs.openstack.org/28841/3/check/gate-grenade-devstack-vm/5335 : FAILURE in 9m 59s (non-voting)
"}, {'account_id': 860, 'date': '2013-05-23 08:53:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

It looks like as we discover more and more apps that create directory objects, it's becoming harder for the code to cleanly identify such objects. However, we know that:

a/ The user (or the app they use) has decided to use directory objects

b/ They want directory listings

Why don't we let them decide what a directory object looks like? Instead of

       X-Container-Meta-Web-Listings: true

Let the user set the content-type of directory objects, e.g:

    X-Container-Meta-Web-Listings: application/folder

Obviously, we continue to allow true/false for backward compatibility."}, {'account_id': 1216, 'date': '2013-05-23 13:05:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

That's an interesting idea. The exact suggestion would not work because I would think some would not want listings but would want index file resolution. But, dare I say it, yet-another-header to turn on dirmarker detection seems like it'd be best here?"}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-05-31 06:03:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Abandoned

'}, {'account_id': 1216, 'date': '2013-06-04 13:48:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

You've changed the cache code in a way that would cause errors during an upgrade and for cache_timeout afterwards. One solution is to check the len of the cache value before deciding how to interpret it. Another is to switch to using a dict like we have with cache code elsewhere and using isinstance with a fallback. Either way, a quick note that it's for backward compatibility reasons and that it should be removed next release would be great. Dunno if we have a standard for that kind of note, but TODO will do for now I'd suppose.

For the _error clearing thing, how about this?

        # Clear and save error header until after non 404/401s are handled
        saved_error = self._error
        self._error = None
        if status_int != HTTP_NOT_FOUND:
            return self._error_response(resp, env, start_response)
        self._error = saved_error

        if status_int != HTTP_NOT_FOUND:
            # Retaining the previous code's behavior of not using custom error
            # pages for non-404 errors.
            self._error = None
            return self._error_response(resp, env, start_response)"}, {'account_id': 1160, 'date': '2013-06-04 21:29:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 1160, 'date': '2013-06-04 21:30:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

I'd also be good if it's changed to only work if the metadata value is set and, if not, to default to how it behaved before. Actually, I'd prefer that, but I'm not overly picky on it. One could always set this to a uuid value if it was causing them any issues."}, {'account_id': 1216, 'date': '2013-06-06 14:12:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I am completely horrible at reviews. I just now noticed that the new cache values would break the previous version of the code which is a problem during upgrades. I have a patch to your patch that would handle this, but you don't have to do it that way -- I just felt bad for the repeated round trips I've made you do on this because I missed stuff. :) Hell, there might be a bug in the fix I'm proposing.

https://gist.github.com/anonymous/878fbe7b617777918581

The side effects that I can see for the above change:

* Slightly elevated memcache gets during an upgrade as the new key is checked and the old key fallen back to.

* Extra memcache get for completely uncached containers, but that should just be one extra every five minutes for each container.

* Extra memcache delete for all PUTs and POSTs to containers (not objects or accounts).

In my mind, these are all fine and we should get the slight extra overhead back after the Openstack Havana release."}, {'account_id': 1160, 'date': '2013-06-06 20:56:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 1160, 'date': '2013-06-06 20:58:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

commit_message:
Treat directory objects as not found

Make StaticWeb search for an index file rather than returning a 0-byte
object.

Add new StaticWeb header to identify a directory marker object:
X-Container-Meta-Web-Directory-Type (default to application/directory)
so user can specify the content type for directory marker objects.
This required requesting the container headers earlier in the code and
clearing the value of _error for non-404 errors.

Add unit tests for directory object scenarios.
Fix end tags in an unrelated HTML block.

Bug 1178817

DocImpact

Change-Id: I561f00c099feaa82fd658f5050bd90c76717da24

commit_message:
Change path to loadbalancer plugin

LoadbalancerPlugin path needs to be changed to reflect renaming
agent_loadbalancer to loadbalancer and moving services directory
one level up.

Change-Id: Ib2ece411b5fb84575673a66421eb474888dd8f43

commit_message:
Fix flavor extra_specs filter doesn't work for number

In extra_specs_ops.match(value, req) function, req are
always string,but value of host capabilities may be number.
When filter host by comparing number with string,even right
os-extra_specs can't pass filter.
We should convert value to string to make the filter work
correctly.

Fixes: bug #1186881

Change-Id: I3e1ab60109673450caae3a7f0bc4a3610ae619ef

commit_message:
added rhel support for ceph. removed template tracking cinder volume init script
in lieu of direct file manipulation. change ceph authentication type to bool.

Change-Id: I695fb79342df4446a301fc1f1da8ce62df561b3b

delete all the tokens for user in one session in the sql backend. For
the kvs and memcache, I also provide the corresponding implementation.

Change-Id: I986a583e5900ea04e26cbdb7c49638a33818bca7

commit_message:
Improve the performance of tokens deletion for user

Provide new delete the tokens api 'delete_tokens' to support
delete all the tokens for user in one session in the sql backend. For
the kvs and memcache, I also provide the corresponding implementation.

Fix bug 1178063

Change-Id: I986a583e5900ea04e26cbdb7c49638a33818bca7
(cherry picked from commit d6cfe4f2e2c7c1b3eb23bf9f864779940a645555)

Mark additional strings as translatable

Some variables and templates variables that should be translatable
weren't marked as such.

Fixes bug #1180316

Note the change in horizon/templates/horizon/common/_quota_summary.html
is not backported in this commit to keep the existing translations work.

Change-Id: I90baf19c4bea09c126f8ed225777037194f5331f
(cherry picked from commit acfb83d5d5e45506cb2198869bc9e345f87ff6ea)

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-05-31 00:18:48.000000000', 'message': 'Increase socket timeout for selenium tests

I can reproduce bug 1100771 consistently in my development environment.
Increasing the socket timeout in the SeleniumTestCase class fixes
the timeout issue for me.

This uncovers another issue that causes an "Address already in use
error". This happens because the order of tear down is wrong - we
need to quit() the driver before continuing with tear down rather
than after.

Fixes bug 1100771.

Change-Id: I95fbea05c3fc2516ce4e736eea9b0823bb5bbf79
(cherry picked from commit 5e58a7e388bf593861a63409ee3ccc20b868a9b5)
'}]
commit_message:
Increase socket timeout for selenium tests

I can reproduce bug 1100771 consistently in my development environment.
Increasing the socket timeout in the SeleniumTestCase class fixes
the timeout issue for me.

This uncovers another issue that causes an "Address already in use
error". This happens because the order of tear down is wrong - we
need to quit() the driver before continuing with tear down rather
than after.

Fixes bug 1100771.

Change-Id: I95fbea05c3fc2516ce4e736eea9b0823bb5bbf79
(cherry picked from commit 5e58a7e388bf593861a63409ee3ccc20b868a9b5)

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-05-22 16:30:36.000000000', 'message': 'Volume IO usage gets reset to 0 after a reboot / crash

Check for reset of block device stats before updating volume usage cache.

If an instance is reboot or crashes, the results of block device stats for
that domain get reset. Add check that if block device stats are lower than
the current stats in the database, then add current values to totals and
update.

Change-Id: I3011872f8d80a1519771f8423001650dcbcc7f5b
Fixes bug: 1169097
(cherry picked from commit a4cb456631f0e70685fbc361eced9baa477a8c56)
'}]
commit_message:
Volume IO usage gets reset to 0 after a reboot / crash

Check for reset of block device stats before updating volume usage cache.

If an instance is reboot or crashes, the results of block device stats for
that domain get reset. Add check that if block device stats are lower than
the current stats in the database, then add current values to totals and
update.

Change-Id: I3011872f8d80a1519771f8423001650dcbcc7f5b
Fixes bug: 1169097
(cherry picked from commit a4cb456631f0e70685fbc361eced9baa477a8c56)

We'd like to enable the backups that are taken and stored as files
in Swift, to be encrypted.
We'll add some new config flags, to mark whether or not encryption
is enabled. At this point, the encryption key will also be stored
as a config value.
When configured to encrypt, the whole process will be streamed
to/from Swift, doing backup->zip->encrypt->Swift and
Swift->decrypt->unzip->restore all during streaming, so we don't
use up more disk space than needed.

Blueprint: encrypted-backups

commit_message:
Adding support for encrypted backups.

We'd like to enable the backups that are taken and stored as files in Swift, to
be encrypted. We'll add some new config flags, to mark whether or not
encryption is enabled. At this point, the encryption key will also be stored as
a config value. When configured to encrypt, the whole process will be streamed
to/from Swift, doing backup -> zip -> encrypt -> Swift and Swift -> decrypt ->
unzip -> restore all during streaming, so we don't use up more disk space than
needed.

Blueprint: encrypted-backups
Change-Id: I05447306f4249bfd8e02de7b008ebda3387b2fbd

commit_message:
set ERROR state when scheduler hits max attempts

Presently when scheduler raises NoValidHost due to max attempts
being reached, the instance remains in a build state.
Exception handler for NoValidHost in manager.run_instance() needs
request_spec[instance_uuids] to know which host to put into an
error state in _set_vm_state_and_notify().
schedule_run_instances() was popping instance_uuids from the
request_spec prior to a call to _schedule().
Changed pop of instance_uuids prior to call to _schedule() to be a get.
Added pop of instance_uuids to beneath call to _schedule() as
individual creates do not need them.

Conflicts:
	nova/scheduler/filter_scheduler.py

Change-Id: I9654820e01d5611763e9e673f15f46b947d09e6d
Fixes: bug #1182056
(cherry picked from commit aefc28dd481354edd0f3b5aec18db006680b2ffe)

commit_message:
Don't update API cell on get_nwinfo

Every call to get_instance_nw_info() updates an instance's info_cache.
The purpose of this is to make sure we're constantly healing the
info_cache table.  However, this causes a lot of unneeded updates
traveling up to the API cell.  Cells has its own periodic task that
heals all instance data.

Fixes bug 1180304

Conflicts:
	nova/network/api.py
	nova/tests/cells/test_cells_messaging.py

Change-Id: I07774712a6358999fd1fdd0f5a90c6f05e3d8d6e
(cherry picked from commit 4251bba3bd456f7ba1c7481bb84d839a5fafc757)

we could use a test case :)'}, {'account_id': 6800, 'date': '2013-06-11 16:02:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

As stated, this needs tests, but also I wonder why you chose to write a context manager instead of just using a try/except block around the dispatch call. I would only see the use if you're going to use that in multiple places."}, {'account_id': 6800, 'date': '2013-06-12 16:30:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

for what it's worth, I've started a unit test module for heat.common.wsgi in this review request: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/32754/"}, {'account_id': 7135, 'date': '2013-06-13 04:24:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

There could be other reasons for writing a context manager other than code reuse, like  separation of concerns, better organized code, and easier to read and understand. And this is a common way how openstack projects deal with this kind of issues, example usage can be found in Nova and Cinder.

Thanks for your efforts to start the unit test moduel. But it effectively made this patch depend on the newly created one. It would cause conflicts if I were to proceed submitting another test_wsgi.py.'}, {'account_id': 7135, 'date': '2013-06-14 08:11:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 7135, 'date': '2013-06-14 08:14:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

tests ported from glance with an additional test case for this'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-06-14 09:00:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

Build succeeded.

I'm unconvinced about the context manager, but it's still an improvement, so +1. thanks for bringing in the unit tests from glance :-)"}, {'account_id': 4328, 'date': '2013-06-16 08:12:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2013-06-17 10:08:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I'm also unconvinced (on the YAGNI principle) about having a context manager here - Nova has one because it's (a) considerably more complex than this, and (b) used in 4 different places.

I'm doubly unconvinced by this implementation (which I realise is copied from Nova) involving fairly obscure language features and workarounds for Python bugs. A more straightforward alternative (IMO) exists:

  @contextlib.contextmanager
  def ResourceExceptionHandler():
    try:
      yield
    except TypeError as ex:
      logging.exception(_('Exception handling resource: %s') % ex)
      raise webob.exc.HTTPBadRequest()"}, {'account_id': 7135, 'date': '2013-06-17 14:23:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Thank you for your detailed expaination. Your point is reasonable enough. And I will update the patch soon to just surround the dispatching call by a try catch block. 
I thought that I could make the contextmanager start simple, and add more "else" clause when needed. But it's better to let it just start with a try catch block and refactor it out to a contextmanager later if it gets complex and can be applied to multiple places.'}, {'account_id': 7135, 'date': '2013-06-18 05:28:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-06-18 06:11:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Works for me

commit_message:
suppress and log API internal exceptions

add a context manager to handle exceptions generated by API
implementation methods or their decorators

Fixes bug #1187881

Change-Id: I4bd75e1e13f8327aaf2283380bf165a57a11ed8c

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-05-14 15:26:34.000000000', 'message': 'Fix powervm driver resize instance error

During a resize operation in powervm, the logical volume
of the instance will be copied and compressed to a file.
Current logic decompresses it twice before copying this file
to a new volume which will cause the new instance to not
boot properly.

Fixes bug #1169848

Change-Id: I91f536919511aafbf7dbe14abbee48dbceb189b2
(cherry picked from commit 5643bd5d9bf17335e109d4b2d93e161f4d12c6f9)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix powervm driver resize instance error

During a resize operation in powervm, the logical volume
of the instance will be copied and compressed to a file.
Current logic decompresses it twice before copying this file
to a new volume which will cause the new instance to not
boot properly.

Fixes bug #1169848

Change-Id: I91f536919511aafbf7dbe14abbee48dbceb189b2
(cherry picked from commit 5643bd5d9bf17335e109d4b2d93e161f4d12c6f9)

index function and handle the error gracefully so a stacktrace is
not generated in the log files. This patch does not change the
API

Fixes bug 1182867

Change-Id: I0764f8abda7176deefe0d103bd86acd0af78780d
(cherry picked from commit 8eede5e9814f3305e0bb66eeb93623ba25b16e9a)

commit_message:
Catch InstanceNotFound in instance_actions GET

Catch the InstanceNotFound exception in the instance_actions
index function and handle the error gracefully so a stacktrace is
not generated in the log files. This patch does not change the
API

Fixes bug 1182867

Change-Id: I0764f8abda7176deefe0d103bd86acd0af78780d
(cherry picked from commit 8eede5e9814f3305e0bb66eeb93623ba25b16e9a)

[{'created': '2013-06-14 03:31:50.000000000', 'message': 'Add an integration test script.

The script is intended to be run on a prepared server such as what
devstack-gate produces.

Test that each of the projects can be installed from scratch without
pbr being previously installed into a plain raw non-distribute-based
virtualenv. This is the closest we can come to testing that pip
installing from the internet is going to work.

We also need to test that this can be done in the various combinations
of setuptools/distribute/pip, and we need to test that pip installing
the repo, the tarball and running python setup.py install work.

Change-Id: If3f17795374cfce726c60de0f09fc2a1e694eea3

commit_message:
Add an integration test script.

The script is intended to be run on a prepared server such as what
devstack-gate produces.

Test that each of the projects can be installed from scratch without
pbr being previously installed into a plain raw non-distribute-based
virtualenv. This is the closest we can come to testing that pip
installing from the internet is going to work.

We also need to test that this can be done in the various combinations
of setuptools/distribute/pip, and we need to test that pip installing
the repo, the tarball and running python setup.py install work.

Change-Id: If3f17795374cfce726c60de0f09fc2a1e694eea3

'}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2013-06-17 17:34:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I was under the Impression that we don't want to retroactively add tests to a stable release of tempest. If we treat this like other stable releases then this counts as a new feature?"}, {'account_id': 5196, 'date': '2013-06-17 18:56:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Do not merge

I believe that Joe is correct. We shouldn't be backporting new tests to the stable releases."}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2013-06-17 22:21:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I think the general discussion at summit was looser than that. We said the core team was probably not interested in adding new tests to older tempest, but if others wanted to, that was fine. It just had to go through the master first paradigm to make sure we weren't adding stable tests that weren't in master.

So I'm ok with this. But I won't override people if they think it's too high a risk."}, {'account_id': 7116, 'date': '2013-06-18 03:39:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

We have this project going on that's based on OpenStack grizzly. A bunch of API tests that we need are not covered in tempest grizzly. That's why I initiated this cherry-pick in the first place. I understand code delivered in a "stable" branch generally requires more considerations. But other than that, is there a better way to address what we need?'}, {'account_id': 1192, 'date': '2013-06-18 14:58:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Sean's comments are correct. I don't see this change as very risky and would be fine with this going in."}, {'account_id': 5196, 'date': '2013-06-18 15:12:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: No score

Ok, I guess I just remembered things wrong.'}, {'account_id': 1192, 'date': '2013-06-18 17:25:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Approved

I think the tempest stable branches are a bit different than stable project branches. The benefits of this preventing future regressions in stable/grizzly code seem to outweigh the change that this change would introduce a regression in tempest itself.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-06-18 17:25:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: No score

Starting gate jobs.
http://status.openstack.org/zuul/'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-06-18 20:08:07.000000000', 'content': 'Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-06-18 20:08:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified

commit_message:
Tests for os-hypervisors API extension of Nova

Tests against following paths are added:
os-hypervisors
os-hypervisors/detail
os-hypervisors/%hyper_id
os-hypervisors/%hyper_name/servers
os-hypervisors/statistics
os-hypervisors/%hyper_id/uptime

Implements: blueprint nova-os-hypervisors-api-extension-test
Change-Id: Ia209b113d0193720b445385e0fe399b81f48bb4b

'}, {'created': '2013-06-14 03:22:56.000000000', 'message': 'Fix the OVS version check to work with upstream master versions of OVS

Fixes bug #1190734

Change-Id: I0102fb57f8ce5529169025efa21a0996ad68bef1
'}, {'created': '2013-06-14 12:44:09.000000000', 'message': 'Fix the OVS version check to work with upstream master versions of OVS.

This patch adds two functions to check version strings in the toplevel
functions file. The openvswitch_agent then uses these to compare versions
when checking for tunneling support. The tunneling version check now
also takes into account upstream master versions of Open vSwitch, which
the previous version check always failed on.

Fixes bug #1190734

commit_message:
Fix the OVS version check to work with upstream master versions of OVS.

This patch adds two functions to check version strings in the toplevel
functions file. The openvswitch_agent then uses these to compare versions
when checking for tunneling support. The tunneling version check now
also takes into account upstream master versions of Open vSwitch, which
the previous version check always failed on.

Fixes bug #1190734

Change-Id: I0102fb57f8ce5529169025efa21a0996ad68bef1

[{'created': '2013-06-16 02:46:15.000000000', 'message': 'exercise euca.sh check the volume just created

In devstack, the exercises/euca.sh test the "VOLUME". it should always
check the volume which was just created. Because there may be volumes
left by the last failed euca.sh, then the variable VOLUME
VOLUME=`euca-describe-volumes | cut -f2`
will be assigned a list of volumes, which is not expected.

Fixes bug #1191424

Change-Id: Ie004c9cfeaef4a8a313866d21d45c7b41f1b2ba0
'}]
commit_message:
exercise euca.sh check the volume just created

In devstack, the exercises/euca.sh test the "VOLUME". it should always
check the volume which was just created. Because there may be volumes
left by the last failed euca.sh, then the variable VOLUME
VOLUME=`euca-describe-volumes | cut -f2`
will be assigned a list of volumes, which is not expected.

Fixes bug #1191424

Change-Id: Ie004c9cfeaef4a8a313866d21d45c7b41f1b2ba0

[{'created': '2013-06-18 01:48:57.000000000', 'message': 'Fix an issue where nova-compute crashes if using the vmware driver and vCenter Server is not available.

The ESX driver gets a connection to vCenter Server on startup.  If VC is not available, nova-compute crashes.  This adds slow retry to which will fix the start up use cases of nova-compute starting before VC.  The errors are logged in case the issue is a mis-confiugration of VC

Change-Id: If20a39b3553d8520c32e70a69c16fde654c17214
Fixes: bug #1192016
'}]
commit_message:
Fix an issue where nova-compute crashes if using the vmware driver and vCenter Server is not available.

The ESX driver gets a connection to vCenter Server on startup.  If VC is not available, nova-compute crashes.  This adds slow retry to which will fix the start up use cases of nova-compute starting before VC.  The errors are logged in case the issue is a mis-confiugration of VC

Change-Id: If20a39b3553d8520c32e70a69c16fde654c17214
Fixes: bug #1192016

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-08-24 19:14:47.000000000', 'message': 'Updates image in Image delete notification

In order to ensure that image properties are sent in image.delete
notification, one of the earlier commits had changed the code to send the
old image information in the notification. But the old image had attribute
values deleted:false and deleted_at:null. So, this patch tries to keep
the old image properties, but ensures that the correct deleted
and deleted_at values are sent.

Fixes bug 1041332

Change-Id: I2e01d6b32069ea7f235cac71b4363c54264f793e
'}]
commit_message:
Updates image in Image delete notification

In order to ensure that image properties are sent in image.delete
notification, one of the earlier commits had changed the code to send the
old image information in the notification. But the old image had attribute
values deleted:false and deleted_at:null. So, this patch tries to keep
the old image properties, but ensures that the correct deleted
and deleted_at values are sent.

Fixes bug 1041332

Change-Id: I2e01d6b32069ea7f235cac71b4363c54264f793e

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-17 16:02:46.000000000', 'message': 'scheduler: Improve task descriptions in debug logs

Tasks that were simply defined as ordinary functions (not methods) were
identified by their repr() in the logs, which is only really desirable as a
last resort and for objects (where the __call__() method is the task). Use
the function name instead.

Change-Id: Ie34a3602deb968979118b0961bcddf226cf5983f
'}]
commit_message:
scheduler: Improve task descriptions in debug logs

Tasks that were simply defined as ordinary functions (not methods) were
identified by their repr() in the logs, which is only really desirable as a
last resort and for objects (where the __call__() method is the task). Use
the function name instead.

Change-Id: Ie34a3602deb968979118b0961bcddf226cf5983f

commit_message:
Support force update quota

Once we have additional check when update quota in
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/25887/, we need provide --force option
when run 'nova quota-update'.

Since the change in nova server has been merged, we need re-enable the
changes in nova client side.

Fix bug 1160749

Change-Id: Iceb67c5816312fafed8a68e48a8a136c03d0bb5b

commit_message:
Fixed restore to wait for full mysqld shutdown before attempting restart

Fixed the issues where after resetting the root password, the
innobackupex strategy was not waiting for the mysqld process to shut
down completely before attempting to restart it.

Fixes bug 1190735

Change-Id: I31524451a44b6e8728eb4ec4285643b69ce13d0e

commit_message:
Prepare repository for a Puppet Forge release

  Commit updates README.md with a consistent template for documentation,
  removes travis.yml since we're on stackfoge now, updates the
  Modulefile for release, removes CHANGELOG in favor of summarized release
  notes in the README that will be viewable on Forge for the new
  release, and moves examples to tests to adhere to Puppet Labs Style
  Guide (http://docs.puppetlabs.com/guides/style_guide.html#tests).

Change-Id: If61952790ce1228561e984ca1664dd14aba0c6ff

commit_message:
Improve tests for Node and Port DB objects.

- Prevented overlaping asserts by separating sequencial
  tests to several small ones.
- Added tests for updating and destroying a port.
- Added more assertions to node reservation tests.

Change-Id: I1f67d24ae1938546c3b6e93caf89013d18b090f3

commit_message:
Remove unused cert db method.

nova.db.sqlalchemy.api contained a certificate_get() method that was
unused.  It was not in the main db.api.  This method was also the only
reference to CertificateNotFound, so remove that as well.

Change-Id: Iba9aece2302e2f175e5d60e48b23959885a81c8d

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-17 22:24:47.000000000', 'message': 'Raise max header size to accommodate large tokens.

The max header is exceeded in the following scenario
- Auth tokens built with a keystone v3 API catalog
- A catalog with approximately 8 or more endpoints defined

Specifically, when heat is enabled in tempest gating, the following
tests are failing:
- tempest.api.compute.test_auth_token.AuthTokenTestJSON.test_v3_token
- tempest.api.compute.test_auth_token.AuthTokenTestXML.test_v3_token

An equivalent fix will be required for all projects which use
eventlet.wsgi.

Fixes bug: #1190149

Change-Id: Ia0a2a48461593fdc0f5be57bcc9f364c3e3f8b66
'}]
commit_message:
Raise max header size to accommodate large tokens.

The max header is exceeded in the following scenario
- Auth tokens built with a keystone v3 API catalog
- A catalog with approximately 8 or more endpoints defined

Specifically, when heat is enabled in tempest gating, the following
tests are failing:
- tempest.api.compute.test_auth_token.AuthTokenTestJSON.test_v3_token
- tempest.api.compute.test_auth_token.AuthTokenTestXML.test_v3_token

An equivalent fix will be required for all projects which use
eventlet.wsgi.

Fixes bug: #1190149

Change-Id: Ia0a2a48461593fdc0f5be57bcc9f364c3e3f8b66

commit_message:
Vanilla plugin configs are more informative now

* Config objects returned contains default values, types and descriptions
* Introduced "importance" field, it help differentiate all configs in UI

Implements blueprint vanilla-plugin-configs-improvements

Change-Id: I8e457d49cc08fbca6cd965c7944fbacfbd5df3c6

commit_message:
change file encoding back to ascii

Fixes:

SyntaxError: Non-ASCII character '\xe2' in file /usr/share/openstack-dashboard/op
enstack_dashboard/local/local_settings.py on line 224, but no encoding declared;
see http://www.python.org/peps/pep-0263.html for details

Change-Id: Idde6845129505cdec775fcdaa3199be4f79ae41d

Shouldn't Berksfile.lock be in the .gitignore list?"}, {'account_id': 216, 'date': '2013-06-13 19:53:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Hi Justin,

Originally we git ignored it b/c it contained FS paths in it, so if I generated it, you would have my homedir path in the lock file. Also, Berkshelf didn't actually use it properly.

With Berkshelf 2.0 it actually uses the lock file, just as bundler uses the Gemfile.lock. Take a look at this review to see why I added it. If I don't add the lock file, the tests will not pass.

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/32301/"}, {'account_id': 1032, 'date': '2013-06-13 20:30:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

That makes sense.. thanks for the explanation'}, {'account_id': 2340, 'date': '2013-06-14 10:20:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

The Berksfile upgrade and the lwrp test refactoring look like separate issues to me. Shouldn't they be in separate commits to make git history easier to read?"}, {'account_id': 216, 'date': '2013-06-14 16:46:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

If you look at the commit message it is necessary.  Tests will not pass w/o the upgrade.'}, {'account_id': 2340, 'date': '2013-06-18 12:56:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Ok, that seems fine. I couldn't test this yet though so I'll leave it for someone else to approve."}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2013-06-18 15:59:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

commit_message:
Clearer registraton LWRP tests

This is a much clearer way to test LWRPs are executed with
the proper options.  The previous approach was hacky, and
relied upon too much stubbing and ruby magik.  Also, updated
to berkshelf 2.0 where Berksfile.lock is respected.  This
is necessary for berkshelf to lock to the proper cookbook
deps in openstack's CI system.

Change-Id: I21c1c000581f2d3c94ff2f9628f0cea0f6536013
