For the most part it looks like this might work pretty well.  The only things I'd want to see added are the IPV6 changes, but that's simple and can be added when I move Cinder to use this."}, {'account_id': 6159, 'date': '2013-06-07 12:38:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Do not merge

(21 inline comments)

Hey,

Thanks a lot for taking care of this. I added some comments in-line.

Also, I think this module should exist inside the version package as a "service" module - or whatever name is best for it - so that it can be imported similar to the way client.py  works. My concern is that methods / APIs might change in the future and this implementation wont help on making those changes without breaking compatibility.


My suggestion is:

1) Create a glanceclient/{module}.py that works as glanceclient/client.py
2) Move this implementation into glanceclient/v1/{module}.py
3) Clean both modules and think about what functions / methods make sense to expose (I saw there are some that are not being used in the module but might be in use in nova / cinder / ...)

I like the idea of moving this code into the client, just want to make sure we clean it up and that we establish a reasonable API that is both forward and backward compatible.

Hope the above makes sense!
Cheers'}, {'account_id': 1726, 'date': '2013-06-13 21:20:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: (8 inline comments)

Agree with your vision of moving it into the version package as a module, although it would need more work an time. 
My idea was to have it landed and clients (nova/cinder/ironic) changed before any code refactoring/redoing.'}, {'account_id': 1726, 'date': '2013-06-13 21:43:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-06-13 22:24:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Works for me

commit_message:
Move glance image service client from nova and cinder into python-glanceclient.

This is now present in nova and cinder, and it will be also needed in ironic,
so moving it into a common location.

List of new files and origin:

glanceclient/image/glance.py  => nova.image.glance <=> cincer.image.glance

glanceclient/exc.py => nova.exception <=> cinder.exception
    GlanceBaseException
    GlanceConnectionFailed
    ImageNotFound
    ImageNotAuthorized
    Invalid

tests/utils.py => nova.test <=> cinder.test
    BaseTestCase

tests/image/matchers.py => nova.tests.matchers
    DictKeysMismatch
    DictMismatch
    DictMatches

tests/unit/image/stubs.py => nova.tests.glance
tests/unit/image/test_glance.py => nova.tests.image

Added new modules from openstack-common:
  jsonutils
  fixture
  context

Change-Id: Ic97a7cf189d84b9f883ae5fba3514e58f6f96ce1
Implements: blueprint image-tools

commit_message:
Make python setup.py test do the right thing.

As a step towards a common interface to running tests even when we're
not in the virtualenv - make python setup.py test actually be useful.

Change-Id: I8e4bc9bb78be37b4d13f8d6c2edfe2d67554ad78

[{'created': '2013-06-18 12:09:55.000000000', 'message': "autoscaling fix LoadBalancer reload static resolve

Since https://review.openstack.org/#/c/31083/ we're using the
Resource.update() method to update the LoadBalancer, which requires
the resource snippet to be statically resolved (as is done in
parser.Stack for stack updates)

Fixes bug #1191705

Change-Id: Id2017a912472ddb48245682c5b6392cbcb9e4c60
"}]
commit_message:
autoscaling fix LoadBalancer reload static resolve

Since https://review.openstack.org/#/c/31083/ we're using the
Resource.update() method to update the LoadBalancer, which requires
the resource snippet to be statically resolved (as is done in
parser.Stack for stack updates)

Fixes bug #1191705

Change-Id: Id2017a912472ddb48245682c5b6392cbcb9e4c60

commit_message:
Session cleanup for db.security_group_rule_* methods

Session objects shouldn't be used in public db.api methods
because db.api should be independent of db implementation.

Remove session parameter from:
test_security_group_rule_destroy
test_security_group_rule_get
test_security_group_rule_get_by_security_group
test_security_group_rule_get_by_security_group_grantee

blueprint db-session-cleanupRoutine refactor.

Change-Id: I36a71547124b655ed89d340fed02315f3b7f1530

Adds tests for XML version response

Adds tests for the version response when use
 Accept: application/xml

To share code, moved assertEqualXML from test_serializer
to keystone.test.

commit_message:
Update Hadoop element for Savanna v0.2

* add ssh configuration
* java installs from tmp directory
* setup ubuntu's directory for ssh connection

Fixes bug#1188438
Implements blueprint savanna-image-elements

Change-Id: I0a5b67a85a13534c7f69af304a4b3532920b856f

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-03 17:04:42.000000000', 'message': "Fix problem where image data is not read from a pipe.

For image-updae and image-create commands, glanceclient attempts to
determine whether image data should be uploaded based on the presence
of data on stdin. Unforunately it is difficult to determine if data is
available, especially when standard in is from a pipe.

This is especially problematic for update operations, where data must
only be uploaded if the image is in queued state. For example data may
be uploaded when the user only wants to rename an image, but the rename
will be rejected because data cannot be uploaded to an unqueued image.

This patch removes the check that attempts to determine if data is
available to read as it didn't work for pipes. It also re-introduces a
check for image state in the update operation, so that glanceclient only
attempts to read data if the image being updated is in queued state.

The image state check is part of the original patchset that was removed
so the patchset could have a single focus [1]

This patch also removes a test for handling empty stdin, and adds a test
for reading stdin from a pipe.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/27536/3/glanceclient/v1/shell.py

Fixes: bug 1184566
Related to: bug 1173044

Change-Id: I8d37f6412a0bf9ca21cbd75cde6a4d5a174e5545
"}]
commit_message:
Fix problem where image data is not read from a pipe.

For image-updae and image-create commands, glanceclient attempts to
determine whether image data should be uploaded based on the presence
of data on stdin. Unforunately it is difficult to determine if data is
available, especially when standard in is from a pipe.

This is especially problematic for update operations, where data must
only be uploaded if the image is in queued state. For example data may
be uploaded when the user only wants to rename an image, but the rename
will be rejected because data cannot be uploaded to an unqueued image.

This patch removes the check that attempts to determine if data is
available to read as it didn't work for pipes. It also re-introduces a
check for image state in the update operation, so that glanceclient only
attempts to read data if the image being updated is in queued state.

The image state check is part of the original patchset that was removed
so the patchset could have a single focus [1]

This patch also removes a test for handling empty stdin, and adds a test
for reading stdin from a pipe.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/27536/3/glanceclient/v1/shell.py

Fixes: bug 1184566
Related to: bug 1173044

Change-Id: I8d37f6412a0bf9ca21cbd75cde6a4d5a174e5545

commit_message:
Remove explicit distribute depend.

Causes issues with the recent re-merge with setuptools. Advice from
upstream is to stop doing explicit depends.

Change-Id: I75916a4fe2f7cf2eb8db2187c03895438aa58efd

'}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2013-06-15 13:12:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

We shouldn't change sqlalchemy migrations that already have been run, for extra safety (yes, it doesn't do anything, but we really really want to tree those as idempotent files, and not change them ever once they've landed). Please pull that change out of the list, then I'm +2."}, {'account_id': 1528, 'date': '2013-06-17 10:08:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Sean, unfortunately I have to disagree. The whole idea behind this cleanup is so that I can enable enforcing of this check so we don't run into those issues in the future. If I cannot change that migration, then the check cannot be reenabled either - which makes the whole effort irrelevant.

The migration step that's being changed is the only affected one and it's trivial to verify the behaviour is not changed. (also, current average number of modifications per migration step is 1.9, with the highest of 6... so they're far from not changed anyway)"}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2013-06-17 14:07:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

I agree with Sean's comments on changing migrations as the general rule, but am willing to make exceptions.  This case is trivial and obvious that it does not change behavior, so it's fine with me."}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2013-06-17 18:08:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

commit_message:
Remove trivial cases of unused variables (1)

Kill some of the variables marked as unused by flakes8. This should
allow to enable F841 check in the future.
Only trivial cases with no function calls and obviously pure functions
(like datetime.now(), or len()) are cleaned up here.

Part 1, split to reduce conflicts.

Change-Id: I82854349574ec4bcb9336aba626eefdaed81a8c8

(1 inline comment)

Seems sane to me ... solid progress

I updated the blueprint with an example:

  [rpc_api_client_caps]
  conductor = 1.48

Trying to think of a way to name the group or options to make it clear it's related to upgrades, but can't think of anything obvious

Would it make sense to be able to do:

  [upgrade_levels]
  conductor = 1.48

i.e. this is a list of the "upgrade levels" of various services, and here we're saying that the conductor service is at 1.48 level

and we could add aliases:

  [upgrade_levels]
  conductor = grizzly

grizzly would be an alias for 1.48

Ok, I was going to +2 and suggest this could be an improvement for the future, but maybe you'd consider the alternative group name'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2013-06-13 12:49:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

Looks cool. I think the current group name is a little long and potentially confusing for the user. "Upgrade levels" sounds better, but I'm not sure if it's the best either.

What about something like "version_compatibility" or something like that?'}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2013-06-13 15:17:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (2 inline comments)

[{'created': '2013-06-12 13:39:17.000000000', 'message': 'Add rpc client side version control.

This is a first pass at client side version control for rpc.  It allows
you to configure a max version of messages that clients are allowed to
send.  You can find one example of how clients need to adapt in the
conductor rpcapi.  All other changes in rpc apis since the grizzly
release are not applicable to this.

Some future improvements to this could be reporting the versions
supported by running services and having that be discoverable via the
API.  We could also consider allow setting these client side version
caps via the API.  For now, recommended values for these config
options while attempting a rolling upgrade will just have to be documented.

commit_message:
Add rpc client side version control.

This is a first pass at client side version control for rpc.  It allows
you to configure a max version of messages that clients are allowed to
send.  You can find one example of how clients need to adapt in the
conductor rpcapi.  All other changes in rpc apis since the grizzly
release are not applicable to this.

Some future improvements to this could be reporting the versions
supported by running services and having that be discoverable via the
API.  We could also consider allow setting these client side version
caps via the API.  For now, recommended values for these config
options while attempting a rolling upgrade will just have to be documented.

The config options allow specifying specific rpc api version numbers if
desired, but an alias of 'grizzly' is also supported.  So typically at
the start of a rolling upgrade you'd have:

    [upgrade_levels]
    compute=grizzly
    conductor=grizzly
    scheduler=grizzly
    ... etc ...

And as you update all instances of a service, you would remove that bit
from your configuration across the deployment using your config management
system of choice.

DocImpact

Implements blueprint rpc-version-control.

Change-Id: I2c0fd6dd7484c87823846d7c31d6525d93cd1b43

commit_message:
Move user fileds type check to identity.Manager

The fileds type's checking logic during creating and updating
users apply to all driver calls. It should be centralized in the
identity.Manager rather that continuing the trend of spreading them out
between controllers, managers and drivers.

This patch move the enable type checking logic to identity.Manager and
modify the related test cases in test_backend.py.

Change-Id: I37df56a61cd5ab332dcc9d74a7e99ee9041aa32e

"}, {'created': '2013-06-14 01:07:50.000000000', 'message': 'Correct the resolving api logic in stat middleware

If the admin_port string is a substring of public_port string, all the
requests would be stated as 'admin' either their real dest port is
admin_port or public_port. It's due to the incorrect logic in stat
middleware.
For example, if public_port = 35000, admin_port = 5000, the first
judgement branch: "if str(CONF.admin_port) in host" in
StatsMiddleware::_resolve_api() would always return "True" either the
host port number equal to 5000 or 35000, so that the following judgement
branches would be incorrectly ignored.

Fixes bug #1189121
Change-Id: I1086b7d11f83dd218d66376f79747a1f720eb807
'}]
commit_message:
Correct the resolving api logic in stat middleware

If the admin_port string is a substring of public_port string, all the
requests would be stated as 'admin' either their real dest port is
admin_port or public_port. It's due to the incorrect logic in stat
middleware.
For example, if public_port = 35000, admin_port = 5000, the first
judgement branch: "if str(CONF.admin_port) in host" in
StatsMiddleware::_resolve_api() would always return "True" either the
host port number equal to 5000 or 35000, so that the following judgement
branches would be incorrectly ignored.

Fixes bug #1189121
Change-Id: I1086b7d11f83dd218d66376f79747a1f720eb807

commit_message:
Remove a stat warning log

If using load balancer before keystone and the port numbers was
different between load balancer and keystone, too many stat warning logs
could be found in logs. The root cause is the keystone servers' stat
logic getting the request host information which point to load balancer
ip address and port rather than the ips and ports of themselves.

Fixes bug #1189118
Change-Id: Ic837af77bc2509086c0e37194ba70b683f693ae5

During template validation, the resources have not been stored in the
database. Therefore any resources that return self.physical_resource_name()
in either FnGetRef() or FnGetAtt() would cause assertions whenever either
of those functions were called during validation. Instead, return None from

commit_message:
Return None for physical resource name during validation

During template validation, the resources have not been stored in the
database. Therefore any resources that return self.physical_resource_name()
in either FnGetRef() or FnGetAtt() would cause assertions whenever either
of those functions were called during validation. Instead, return None from
physical_resource_name() in this phase, as we do for other data that is not
available yet during validation.

Fixes bug #1191931

Change-Id: I1a5b17557ae1ca2600fb930e74eb5248c82e0326

commit_message:
Standardise resource names in Invalid Attribute errors

These should always refer to the resource name in the template (i.e.
logical resource name), and never the physcial resource name (since these
errors necessarily occur during validation, before any physical resource is
created).

Change-Id: I6cf6625cf32a90acb27adc6348695c086dc5e119

[{'created': '2013-05-20 16:46:35.000000000', 'message': "Don't snat all traffic when force_snat_range set

When using /proc/sys/net/bridge/bridge-nf-call-iptables=1, bridged
traffic gets snatted even though it is being bridged out to an
external gateway. This can lead to async routes where traffic
goes out the fixed network and comes back on the float network
and can lead to packets being blocked by firewalls. Work around
this problem by only fallback snatting when the traffic is
going to one of the force_snat_ranges. If force_snat_range is not
set it defaults to the existing behavior of snatting all traffic
that doesn't hit an earlier rule.

Fixes bug 1182143

Change-Id: If496dad2308a68a6a4a9fd43d695943bc5034ac4

commit_message:
Don't snat all traffic when force_snat_range set

When using /proc/sys/net/bridge/bridge-nf-call-iptables=1, bridged
traffic gets snatted even though it is being bridged out to an
external gateway. This can lead to asymmetric routes where traffic
goes out the fixed network and comes back on the float network
and can lead to packets being blocked by firewalls. Work around
this problem by only fallback snatting when the traffic is
going to one of the force_snat_ranges. If force_snat_range is not
set it defaults to the existing behavior of snatting all traffic
that doesn't hit an earlier rule.

Fixes bug 1182143

Change-Id: If496dad2308a68a6a4a9fd43d695943bc5034ac4
(cherry picked from commit 769782be844e4c74fdc0aad0ff704b06c874c3ad)

commit_message:
Remove _is_precooked pre-cells Zones hacks

pre-Cells Zones used to talk to child zones via the API and thus things
didn't need to be re-serialized for API responses.  The hacks for this
were left around and should be removed.

Fixes bug 1192006

Change-Id: I0b0c7fcad49412659d97037fc3cc8594b46668f1

commit_message:
Convert Resource to separate action/status

Next step in decoupling action/status

This adjusts the Resource DB columns, model and class to be consistent
with Event, and split action/status.  This also modifies the both APIs
to join the action/status to avoid changing the API (we can't change
the CFN one anyway and it's desirable to avoid breaking compatibility
with the ReST API, or needing a version bump for this simple change)

Change-Id: I02b56eb14045a058e67b9764d386530d555c339e

[{'created': '2013-06-04 19:00:46.000000000', 'message': 'Grizzly compatibility with Havana Qpid messages

A change had to be made in the Havana Qpid implementation that is
not entirely backwards compatible.  This change allows Grizzly to
receive messages in the new format.

Backport of change for bug 1175808

Change-Id: I8b6c5734b67cd33cdd5ef0659bdd77504317187d
'}]
commit_message:
Grizzly compatibility with Havana Qpid messages

A change had to be made in the Havana Qpid implementation that is
not entirely backwards compatible.  This change allows Grizzly to
receive messages in the new format.

Backport of change for bug 1175808

Change-Id: I8b6c5734b67cd33cdd5ef0659bdd77504317187d

commit_message:
cinder.schedule: Replace 'locals()' with explicit values

Help bring source code into compliance with the Cinder Style Commandments:
https://github.com/openstack/cinder/blob/master/HACKING.rst

This change covers all affected source in the cinder scheduler module, i.e.
cinder/scheduler/*.py and subdirectories.

Partially fixes: bug #1190748

Change-Id: I75ad858ee62317bef6c59b9c0896f8a94a989d52

commit_message:
Document NVP QoS extension

This patch creates a new section for plugins to document their extensions
and adds documentation for the NVP QoS extension.

Fixes bug 1158575

Change-Id: I847cca33e55fd2d9e46fc1cc78280c75396bc4b3

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-05-30 18:00:30.000000000', 'message': 'Fixing get_panel_groups uncaught exception

The get_dashboards method in horizon/base.py returns dashboards
that have been unregistered. Subsequently calling get_panel_groups
on that dashboard causes an uncaught exception.

Fixes: bug#1185914

Change-Id: Ia5a7e7d19e7d2f04731a6840858cd9d9b91cfe00
'}]
commit_message:
Fixing get_panel_groups uncaught exception

The get_dashboards method in horizon/base.py returns dashboards
that have been unregistered. Subsequently calling get_panel_groups
on that dashboard causes an uncaught exception.

Fixes: bug#1185914

Change-Id: Ia5a7e7d19e7d2f04731a6840858cd9d9b91cfe00

commit_message:
Use common.processutils.execute

This patch replaces the cinder.utils.execute method
with a wrapper around openstack.common.processutils.execute.

With the wrapper I'm also converting the processutils exceptions
to maintain compatability with the existing exceptions that are
caught/raised in the code.

Change-Id: Ibc36a1e83191e7c888ea62c55d28b7023535d9fa

'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2013-05-29 18:06:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(3 inline comments)

A few small comments inline."}, {'account_id': 5441, 'date': '2013-05-29 21:07:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

I'm still working my way through this patch, but wanted to jot down some initial thoughts.

I'm not sure that this is really the right approach for this problem.  The os-resetState action allows you to set an arbitrary state and doesn't make assumptions about failure or success.  This patch introduces that concept in there and makes assumptions about how you would like to fix it.  So I don't think this is the right place for this.  I would almost rather see migrations become accessible resources with limited update abilities, but that opens a whole new can of worms that is probably best avoided.

I would suggest that you send a message to the openstack-dev mailing list explaining the problem you want to solve and discussing this solution to see what feedback that provides."}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2013-05-30 01:29:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: Do not merge

I think Andrew's comments are very good.  Let's take this to the mailing list to see if we can achieve some consensus around the problem and desired solution."}, {'account_id': 6992, 'date': '2013-05-31 06:13:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: (4 inline comments)

'}, {'account_id': 5441, 'date': '2013-05-31 13:07:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2013-06-03 17:30:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

I don't think this is the proper solution to force a revert of a resize, i.e. its not the right way to implement the blueprint you reference.

However, this is a useful patch where a manual fix of resize has occurred, and you need to put the db into a certain state before you can use the standard revert-resize logic to tidy things up. Just to stop OPs people having to hack the database."}, {'account_id': 6992, 'date': '2013-06-10 10:07:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

I have started a discussion in dev community. Looks like not many of them are affected by this problem because I don't see a lot of responses.

Let's try to decide on an approach to solve this problem and go ahead with it. 

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2013-June/009995.html"}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-06-18 06:03:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-06-18 06:03:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}]

'}, {'created': '2013-05-22 12:43:59.000000000', 'message': 'Support should be able to revert-resize when it fails or hangs

Change-Id: Ia20ae3c4b34788d4ed3c44637a1fdde5ed24ff39
Implements: blueprint revert-resize-force-option
'}, {'created': '2013-05-29 10:13:42.000000000', 'message': 'API to reset a db state of a migration

Extending the resetState action on servers, to fix failed migrations.
When a migration hangs or fails, the migration is recovered.
This API is called to reset the migration and instance states to mark the
migration as complete or to revert the migration.

Change-Id: Ia20ae3c4b34788d4ed3c44637a1fdde5ed24ff39
Implements: blueprint revert-resize-force-option
'}, {'created': '2013-05-29 13:30:32.000000000', 'message': "API to reset a db state of a migration

Extending the resetState action on servers, to fix failed migrations.
When a migration hangs or fails, the migration is recovered.
This API is called to reset the migration and instance states to mark the
migration as complete or to revert the migration.

DocImpact: When server action os-resetState action is called with
fix-failed-migration flag, the server vm_state is set to 'resized' and
the server migration status is set to 'finished' so that the server
resize can be reverted

Change-Id: Ia20ae3c4b34788d4ed3c44637a1fdde5ed24ff39
Implements: blueprint revert-resize-force-option
"}, {'created': '2013-05-29 16:58:50.000000000', 'message': "API to reset a db state of a migration

Extending the resetState action on servers, to fix failed migrations.
When a migration hangs or fails, the migration is recovered.
This API is called to reset the migration and instance states to mark the
migration as complete or to revert the migration.

DocImpact: When server action os-resetState action is called with
fix-failed-migration flag, the server vm_state is set to 'resized' and
the server migration status is set to 'finished' so that the server
resize can be reverted

Change-Id: Ia20ae3c4b34788d4ed3c44637a1fdde5ed24ff39
Implements: blueprint revert-resize-force-option
"}]
commit_message:
API to reset a db state of a migration

Extending the resetState action on servers, to fix failed migrations.
When a migration hangs or fails, the migration is recovered.
This API is called to reset the migration and instance states to mark the
migration as complete or to revert the migration.

DocImpact: When server action os-resetState action is called with
fix-failed-migration flag, the server vm_state is set to 'resized' and
the server migration status is set to 'finished' so that the server
resize can be reverted

Change-Id: Ia20ae3c4b34788d4ed3c44637a1fdde5ed24ff39
Implements: blueprint revert-resize-force-option

- http://logs.openstack.org/31567/1/check/gate-nova-pylint/12851 : SUCCESS in 9m 27s (non-voting)
'}, {'account_id': 1082, 'date': '2013-06-04 00:14:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Whether or not an operating system can "resize down" is not something that nova should know or care about.  If the user said "resize down".

Does BSD support resize_down ?  Does cirros ? does windows 2017 ? nova itself shouldn't know, care, or maintain a matrix of combinations that is almost guaranteed to be wrong a year after a release of nova.'}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2013-06-04 14:55:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

So we need a launchpad bug this this, so it can describe the error situation and what happens.

Give our previous chat, I think this test could be added here:
https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/virt/xenapi/vmops.py#L827

But I am not sure why the auto_disk_config flag is not sufficient, and if not, why the edge cases don't get caught by this check:
https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/virt/xenapi/vm_utils.py#L798"}, {'account_id': 5441, 'date': '2013-06-10 14:42:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Do not merge

I think Scott and John make excellent points.  First, though there may be some value in blocking resize based on image properties, os_type is not the right one to use.  And secondly, Windows resize downs are probably already blocked by another condition and if not lets address that without resorting to os_type.'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-06-18 06:03:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-06-18 06:03:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}]

[{'created': '2013-06-03 21:51:07.000000000', 'message': 'Resize down should be blocked by os type and not auto_disk flag

If it is a resize down and the os_type of instance is Windows then raise an error in API layer

Change-Id: Ic75c576a03a8e9d2dc42789a8605c944a11549f1
'}]
commit_message:
Resize down should be blocked by os type and not auto_disk flag

If it is a resize down and the os_type of instance is Windows then raise an error in API layer

Change-Id: Ic75c576a03a8e9d2dc42789a8605c944a11549f1

'}, {'account_id': 1216, 'date': '2013-06-03 14:15:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Python 2.6 urlparse doesn't really have ipv6 support. :( But maybe a different approach would support 2.6 and 2.7?


    Python 2.6.5 (r265:79063, Oct  1 2012, 22:04:36) 
    [GCC 4.4.3] on linux2
    Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.
    >>> from urlparse import urlparse
    >>> v = urlparse('http://[fe80::20c:29ff:feab:3527]:8080/v1/a/c/o')
    >>> v.hostname
    '[fe80'
    >>> v.netloc
    '[fe80::20c:29ff:feab:3527]:8080'
    >>> v.netloc.rsplit(':', 1)[0].lstrip('[').rstrip(']')
    'fe80::20c:29ff:feab:3527'
    >>> v = urlparse('http://123.456.789.012:8080/v1/a/c/o')
    >>> v.hostname
    '123.456.789.012'
    >>> v.netloc
    '123.456.789.012:8080'
    >>> v.netloc.rsplit(':', 1)[0].lstrip('[').rstrip(']')
    '123.456.789.012'
    >>>'}, {'account_id': 1216, 'date': '2013-06-03 14:17:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Er damn, sent the comment and then realized that doesn't really work either for when a port isn't specified. :/ Probably have to make your own netloc parse function and plop it in swift.common.utils or something."}, {'account_id': 6593, 'date': '2013-06-09 11:43:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Is there a need in supporting IPv6 with Python 2.6.x? I'd be fine with supporting IPv6 with Python 2.7.x only, as long as the code is in a way that it can actually support it. Given that this has been broken all the time I don't see a strong reason for coming up with a solution that satisfies 2.6.x usecase."}, {'account_id': 1216, 'date': '2013-06-10 14:04:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Hehe, well, considering it's been broken all this time for 2.7 as well...

There are installations that use 2.6. I'll leave my -1 but two other +2s can override my opinion, of course."}, {'account_id': 2696, 'date': '2013-06-10 14:31:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

FWIW, I agree that if it's worth fixing, it's worth fixing for both 2.6 and 2.7.  It'll also need unit tests (which tox will run in python 2.6 and 2.7)."}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-06-18 06:03:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Fix Display of IPv6 hostnames

IPv6 addresses can contain ':' legitimately, so
use urlparse's hostname accessor instead.

[{'created': '2013-06-10 20:04:57.000000000', 'message': ' Handle UnexpectedTaskState and InstanceNotFound exceptions

    UnexpectedTaskState and InstanceNotFound are thrown when a delete of the
    instance happens before the ongoing action is completed.
    These are to be handled gracefully.
    These exceptions have to be logged and not reraised, as they are false
    alarms.

    Fixes: bug #1186447

    Change-Id: I0647935c4452d4294f49a4c0d08e480584ebec7c

Change-Id: Ic4451ecb6f21a738941a1f0399a688676400fed9
'}]
commit_message:
Handle UnexpectedTaskState and InstanceNotFound exceptions

    UnexpectedTaskState and InstanceNotFound are thrown when a delete of the
    instance happens before the ongoing action is completed.
    These are to be handled gracefully.
    These exceptions have to be logged and not reraised, as they are false
    alarms.

    Fixes: bug #1186447

    Change-Id: I0647935c4452d4294f49a4c0d08e480584ebec7c

Change-Id: Ic4451ecb6f21a738941a1f0399a688676400fed9

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-07 18:15:48.000000000', 'message': 'Major restructuring of the exchange topology to solve leaky exchange issue.

This also gets away from creating exchanges for all sort of htings.

The emphasis now is on AMQP 1.0 type addressing.  There is no need for lots
of exchanges.

This will also help simplify any federation that may be needed for federation.
The topology is now all under the amq.topic excahnge.

amq.topic/topic/sometopicHLQ.sometopicLLQ.etc.
amq.topic/direct/somedirectaddress
amq.topic/fanout/somefanoutname

Change-Id: I4ea49c0b89d7ed39dfa671cb1df57884dd0193c4
'}]
commit_message:
Major restructuring of the exchange topology to solve leaky exchange issue.

This also gets away from creating exchanges for all sort of htings.

The emphasis now is on AMQP 1.0 type addressing.  There is no need for lots
of exchanges.

This will also help simplify any federation that may be needed for federation.
The topology is now all under the amq.topic excahnge.

amq.topic/topic/sometopicHLQ.sometopicLLQ.etc.
amq.topic/direct/somedirectaddress
amq.topic/fanout/somefanoutname

Change-Id: I4ea49c0b89d7ed39dfa671cb1df57884dd0193c4

"}, {'account_id': 5638, 'date': '2013-06-07 11:34:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Looks like this should prereq - https://review.openstack.org/#/c/31982/2/heat/engine/parser.py,unified - since that one defines SUSPEND_IN_PROGRESS used in this review ("heat/tests/test_engine_api_utils.py", line 102)'}, {'account_id': 4571, 'date': '2013-06-09 22:18:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

I've had a look at what horizon does now for the nova actions menu. This is typical:

https://github.com/openstack/horizon/blob/master/openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/instances/tables.py#L111

It just enables actions based on the state of the instance, and that state logic is in horizon itself. The Nova actions extension is not used in horizon.

Right now horizon isn't particularly AJAXy so the actions menu for each instance will be built when the row is rendered (and it will be continually re-rendered while the instance is in an in-progress state)

I think a separate list-actions API call wouldn't be used in a UI - the extra requests would just add latency. I don't object to it existing, but the same info needs to be attached to the stack info for a stack list or get.  Horizon will just check the stack's allowed_actions to decide what to populate the actions menu with.

so tl:dr, -1 so that this change also puts allowed actions in format_stack"}, {'account_id': 4328, 'date': '2013-06-10 07:56:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Ok, based on stevebaker's comments re Horizon, I may just drop the list aspect of this patch series, if Horizon won't use it it's probably pointless to maintain it, we can just fail with an error if e.g someone tries to resume a stack which isn't suspended.

It does seem a bit odd to push all the logic to figure this out up to the UI, but if that's the status-quo then fine, it's one less thing to worry about inside heat ;)"}, {'account_id': 4571, 'date': '2013-06-10 23:14:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

To clarify, I don't think we should push the logic into horizon, rather it should be pushed into parser.Stack.

Any time a stack entity is returned from the API (get or list) that entity should include a list of allowed actions. Horizon can read that list and show what actions are available."}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-06-18 06:03:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-06-18 06:03:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}]

commit_message:
engine : Add list_stack_actions RPC call

Adds new RPC call which lists actions allowable for a stack
the only action initially included is stack_suspend, which
will be used in subsequent API and engine patches implementing
initial stack-suspend support

blueprint: stack-suspend-resume
Change-Id: I10c53ccacc514e555e45806e88a778462ad78ba6

commit_message:
Respect a user provided install-directory.

Previously when --root=X is given the easy install action
ignores this and attempts to install to /usr/lib/python2.6/
which errors out due to the easy install testing of where
it can write to. This is unexpected behavior when a user
provided user is given (since it should not be installing
in the system path if a different install directory is
provided).

This is affecting the running of `rpmbuild` since the rpmbuild
command expects to be able to assign a new root for its files
and then pbr doesn't respect that root location. This kills
the rpmbuild and any packages which use pbr from being able to
be correctly build by `rpmbuild -ba` (or similar).

Change-Id: I774a5c61d4c4a70133c876a6a5d841344728df2b

commit_message:
Catch socket exception when keystone is already started

Instead of an ugly stack trace, we log a message and exit

Fixes LP# 1186394

Change-Id: I32e137e4def2dab49aeb97d4603cf77018f4515d

Hi Tatyana.

First of all, apologies for keeping this patch lingering for so long.

For fixing this bug I would suggest to remove the InvalidContentType exception in quantumclient.common.exceptions altogether, rather than having it inheriting the exception in openstack.common (more than inheritance this is aliasing actually).
This will result in a larger patch, but definitely cleaner.
The only reasons why we ended up with two exceptions here is that the one in QuantumClient was introduces before the openstack.common modules were merged.

Also, I think that the unit tests you are introducing should be put in a separate patch with a distinct bug tracker.'}, {'account_id': 6719, 'date': '2013-06-18 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 6719, 'date': '2013-06-18 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Work In Progress'}, {'account_id': 7543, 'date': '2013-06-18 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-18 06:03:03.000000000', 'message': "Fix InvalidContentType can't be raised because of error in constructor

InvalidContentType exception class is defined two times:
in quantumclient.openstack.common.exception and quantumclient.common.exceptions
with two different signatures.
A lot of code like Serializer.serialize() imports one of them but
attempts to use it with the signature of another one, which ends with
TypeError exception.

This change fixes the bug by removing the second definition of
InvalidContentType class and leaving only one which works correctly
with all code. Also adds unit tests.

Fixes bug #1131724

Change-Id: I4b9c40ccc77ec09678134e36a88f979eaa6fbfa8
"}, {'created': '2013-06-18 06:03:03.000000000', 'message': "Fix InvalidContentType can't be raised because of error in constructor

attempts to use it with the signature of another one, which ends with
TypeError exception.

This change fixes the bug by removing the second definition of
InvalidContentType class and leaving only one which works correctly
with all code. Also adds unit tests.

Fixes bug #1131724

Change-Id: I4b9c40ccc77ec09678134e36a88f979eaa6fbfa8

commit_message:
Fix InvalidContentType can't be raised because of error in constructor

InvalidContentType exception class is defined two times:
in quantumclient.openstack.common.exception and quantumclient.common.exceptions
with two different signatures.
A lot of code like Serializer.serialize() imports one of them but
attempts to use it with the signature of another one, which ends with
TypeError exception.

This change fixes the bug by removing the second definition of
InvalidContentType class and leaving only one which works correctly
with all code. Also adds unit tests.

Fixes bug #1131724

Change-Id: I4b9c40ccc77ec09678134e36a88f979eaa6fbfa8

Until the changes in python-keystoneclient are released, using a newer boto will break any user of keystone that doesn't have them. So marking this WIP until then."}, {'account_id': 6488, 'date': '2013-06-04 04:11:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Do not merge

So, the latest keystoneclient is out, and should fix this. But, I'm worried that if the next heat-cfntools releases with this relaxed requirement, it will mysteriously stop working because of newer boto versions in the client instances. What we really need is for boto to provide us with a way to force old signatures, at least until the latest keystoneclient has had time to make its way into most systems. Another thing to consider is to have keystone havana depend on >= this keystoneclient so that we can know that havana works with newer botos."}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-06-18 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Abandoned

commit_message:
Boto no longer needs to be pinned to 2.5.2.

EC2 signing of v4 keys works fine, so newer boto will be fine. Meanwhile
this version of boto interferes with cloud-init 0.7.2.

Fixes bug #1180582

Change-Id: Ic298499c2e10cee6ddcaa5b2c3180ea4967fbd92

  cliutils.validate_args() only check arguments count,won't provide more
helpful info about what arg is missing, should use required option of

commit_message:
Make nova manage/baremetal-manage command output more helpful

The code contains following changes:
1.Print subcommand action help message when missing argument
  exception catched.(nova-manage/nova-baremetal-manage)
2.Catch exceptions on network subcommand actions and output
  messages for debug.(nova-manage)
3.Add help messages for agent subcommand and logs subcommand.
  (nova-manage)

Fix bug: 1185902

Change-Id: I1da0d9e1307cf5a6eed26c7d136b2001913a4314

commit_message:
Retry when keystone server refuses connections

Add an additional error type to avoid keystone client queries erroring
out while keystone server is being restarted

Change-Id: I5e3dd598af6f5bd72eae51f354ddde3cb0c0e07d

commit_message:
Add InstanceId property to EIP resource

This also changes the InstanceId property for an EIPAssociation
to not be required, which was necessary for testing and is inline
with AWS documentation.

Change-Id: I49dd506309fe6a38df6727bca7f6bbebd45fba3f
Fixes: bug #1164864

created a stub section on KVM performance.

There were some build failures to do with dashboard files
moving around, so fixed those up too.

commit_message:
Add note about vnethost for KVM

The vnethost module can be loaded for added performance, so
created a stub section on KVM performance.

There were some build failures to do with dashboard files
moving around, so fixed those up too.

fixes bug 1064757

Cherry-picked from https://review.openstack.org/32356

Change-Id: Ibcd1797c8db0d0a147a64e567a95ce13f4bd1d3a

commit_message:
Remove unused zmq relay functionality

Fixes bug #1188029

This relay functionality appears to be completely unused and untested
so just remove it. If we need it in future, we can restore it from the
git history.

Change-Id: I479d654aefdbd58c80946818b9a405eaa02644db

commit_message:
engine : abstract state-transition logic

Refactor to abstract the handle_create/check_create_complete
logic, so it can be reused without lots of duplication for
other action transitions

Prompted by review comments from:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/31982/2/heat/engine/resource.py
related to blueprint: stack-suspend-resume

Change-Id: Idb18913ef6ff700b63d5ec6d340d2353fc2294b7

Are you sure this bug still exists ?  

I just tried on a clean new devstack instance and couldn't reproduce it.  Neither can I see any path in the delete code that calls confirm_resize

Can you be more explicit about the code path that leads to confirm_resize being called during deletion please ?"}, {'account_id': 7532, 'date': '2013-06-17 04:40:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Resize an instance but don't do the confirm_resize step.
The instance will then be in 'resized' status.

Now do a delete on the instance: In the _delete method in compute/api.py:
1. The instance is set to 'deleting' task state 
2. Next there is a check to see:
if instance['vm_state'] == vm_states.RESIZED: 
   then do a confirm_resize

As the last step of confirm_resize, an instance update is done. This 
fails because the expected task_state is 'None' but is actually 'deleting'."}, {'account_id': 1501, 'date': '2013-06-17 21:51:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Hi Aditi,

Ok thanks, got it now.  I was looking for the call to confirm_resize in the compute manager code. 

Still not sure why those steps don't reproduce the issue on Devstack, but I get the reason for the change now"}, {'account_id': 191, 'date': '2013-06-17 22:55:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

commit_message:
Allow confirm_resize if instance is in 'deleting' status

Deleting an instance puts it into 'deleting' task_state.
If the instance is in 'resized' vm_status, this tries a
confirm_resize on the instance. confirm_resize currently expects
the task_state to be None. It should instead expect
None/deleting task_state.

Fixes bug: 1189391

Change-Id: I6a3f82eab9ed2242bfd38bc1ac760dbb4b3d8c4a

Change-Id: I2ca665e70fc6d3c9664ae7a74dffd99a56f6a8c1

commit_message:
Make NovaObject support extra attributes in items()

An object could define a field as a property, which needs to get
included in items() and iteritems() for dict compatibility.

Related to blueprint unified-object-model

Change-Id: I2ca665e70fc6d3c9664ae7a74dffd99a56f6a8c1

Adds support for ExtendedFloatingIps APi extension

Allow a floating IP to be associated to a specific fixed IP

This is the client side of:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/26113/15

Remove bin lookup in conf sample generator

As of 584b2f, the bin directory has been removed.
No longer need to handle bin/

commit_message:
Use Python 3.x compatible octal numbers

Unfortunately, Python 3.x deprecated support for 0755
octal numbers. Use 0o755 instead.

Change-Id: I70403d382d6e6569445b6a99954ea24d436f29ad

[{'created': '2013-06-17 11:01:10.000000000', 'message': 'Add unique constraints to Cell.

In documentation: "name: Name of the current cell. This must be
unique for each cell"
Added unique constraint 'uniq_cell_name0deleted' ('name','deleted')
to Cell model and migrate sripts.
Added new exception `CellsExists`. Updated cell_create() in db.api.
Tests updated respectively.

blueprint db-enforce-unique-keys

Change-Id: Ib76e167089cb4756e4438613b49013ebf0874afe
'}]
commit_message:
Add unique constraints to Cell.

In documentation: "name: Name of the current cell. This must be
unique for each cell"
Added unique constraint 'uniq_cell_name0deleted' ('name','deleted')
to Cell model and migrate sripts.
Added new exception `CellsExists`. Updated cell_create() in db.api.
Tests updated respectively.

blueprint db-enforce-unique-keys

Change-Id: Ib76e167089cb4756e4438613b49013ebf0874afe

commit_message:
Don't create /var/log/nova.

Since we are using upstart for logs we should not be creating
/var/log/nova/* since it will be empty and just cause confusion.

Don't create /var/log/nova upon install and disable watchedfile logging
handler, since we use upstart to record stdout, and using that handler
creates an empty /var/log/nova/nova.log.

Change-Id: Ic1c71f01c226ec9d29a74ad41a80a9d368833979

version. If we don't specify the versions here, some of the

commit_message:
Update requirements to fix devstack installation

Updating kombu to a newer version also requires a new anyjson
version. If we don't specify the versions here, some of the
other projects install older versions that don't work together
when running under devstack.

Fixes bug #1134575

Change-Id: Idcb45ca4b2c5d947b01a8b75f7906a3df6380ebe
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug.hellmann@dreamhost.com>

commit_message:
cinder/.: replace 'locals()' with explicit values

Help bring source code into compliance with the Cinder Style Commandments:
https://github.com/openstack/cinder/blob/master/HACKING.rst

This change covers all affected source directly in the top-level directory
of the cinder module, i.e. cinder/*.py

Partially fixes: bug #1190748

Change-Id: Ice5efc5eda7189969af6a9b722344fad7aa49ff0

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-15 21:24:18.000000000', 'message': 'Http 400 when project enabled is not a boolean

Having enabled="true" in json data when updating tenant will produce 500

When updating a project, no type check was performed on the enabled
attribute. Therefore, if enabled value in JSON/XML is not a boolean but
a string, keystone responds with an incorrect Http 500 error code and
the stacktrace.

The change introduces a type validation of the enabled attribute at
identity manager. If the type is not a boolean, keystone now returns an
appropriate Http 400 error code with a message pointing a bad format for
the attribute.

Test cases have been added to file test_backend and test_content_types
for testing the case when enabled attribute is a string or int when
updating project.

Fixes bug #1191384

Change-Id: I86dd7e71d4bac1e3fd6fcabaa1a2136a47722e5f
'}]
commit_message:
Http 400 when project enabled is not a boolean

Having enabled="true" in json data when updating tenant will produce 500

When updating a project, no type check was performed on the enabled
attribute. Therefore, if enabled value in JSON/XML is not a boolean but
a string, keystone responds with an incorrect Http 500 error code and
the stacktrace.

The change introduces a type validation of the enabled attribute at
identity manager. If the type is not a boolean, keystone now returns an
appropriate Http 400 error code with a message pointing a bad format for
the attribute.

Test cases have been added to file test_backend and test_content_types
for testing the case when enabled attribute is a string or int when
updating project.

Fixes bug #1191384

Change-Id: I86dd7e71d4bac1e3fd6fcabaa1a2136a47722e5f

The refresh() method pulls a fresh copy of the instance but if any
fields changed when doing so, they are left marked as changes that
are not yet committed.

Also clarified the doc string for obj_what_changed() to state that a set
is returned, not a list.

This method is not used yet, so I didn't file a bug for this.

Change-Id: I83fbce07936fea2bc936441c5c6594f65da443a7
"}]
commit_message:
Fix instance obj refresh()

The refresh() method pulls a fresh copy of the instance but if any
fields changed when doing so, they are left marked as changes that
are not yet committed.

Also clarified the doc string for obj_what_changed() to state that a set
is returned, not a list.

This method is not used yet, so I didn't file a bug for this.

Change-Id: I83fbce07936fea2bc936441c5c6594f65da443a7

[{'created': '2013-06-17 15:58:30.000000000', 'message': "Fix overzealous conductor test for vol_usage_update

The rest of the conductor tests are pretty unit-esque, in that
they don't test the underlying functionality. Rather, they confirm
that the various conductor APIs (public, local, rpc, and manger)
all agree and that the plumbing between them works as expected.

The test_vol_usage_update() test does too much, and as a result,
gets all twisted in how it mucks with mox to stub out utcnow()
without breaking the base test harness. Unfortunately, it seems
to fail quite often, depending on testr ordering, and has been
blocking the gate quite a bit lately.

This patch refactors that test to be like all the rest of the
conductor tests. It also removes the useless mirror test of
test_vol_usage_update_again().

Fixes bug 1190971

Change-Id: I815b25f6585786a8dbd5eefcfb39e2b4790641cb
"}, {'created': '2013-06-17 16:46:18.000000000', 'message': "Fix overzealous conductor test for vol_usage_update

The rest of the conductor tests are pretty unit-esque, in that

The test_vol_usage_update() test does too much, and as a result,
gets all twisted in how it mucks with mox to stub out utcnow()
without breaking the base test harness. Unfortunately, it seems
to fail quite often, depending on testr ordering, and has been
blocking the gate quite a bit lately.

Fixes bug 1190971

Change-Id: I815b25f6585786a8dbd5eefcfb39e2b4790641cb
"}]
commit_message:
Fix overzealous conductor test for vol_usage_update

The rest of the conductor tests are pretty unit-esque, in that
they don't test the underlying functionality. Rather, they confirm
that the various conductor APIs (public, local, rpc, and manger)
all agree and that the plumbing between them works as expected.

The test_vol_usage_update() test does too much, and as a result,
gets all twisted in how it mucks with mox to stub out utcnow()
without breaking the base test harness. Unfortunately, it seems
to fail quite often, depending on testr ordering, and has been
blocking the gate quite a bit lately.

This patch refactors that test to be like all the rest of the
conductor tests. It also removes the useless mirror test of
test_vol_usage_update_again().

Fixes bug 1190971

Change-Id: I815b25f6585786a8dbd5eefcfb39e2b4790641cb

[{'created': '2013-06-16 00:30:32.000000000', 'message': 'python3: Fix traceback while running tests.

Fix:

TypeError: Unicode-objects must be encoded before hashing

while running tests. This is due to the fact in python3 hashlib.md5
works with bytes and we are passing unicode strings.

Change-Id: I0adde942423af28572473030f6685e12cd8f7dae
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>
'}]
commit_message:
python3: Fix traceback while running tests.

Fix:

TypeError: Unicode-objects must be encoded before hashing

while running tests. This is due to the fact in python3 hashlib.md5
works with bytes and we are passing unicode strings.

Change-Id: I0adde942423af28572473030f6685e12cd8f7dae
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>

commit_message:
Set ZUUL_URL before configuring workspace.

ZUUL_URL needs to be set before the setup_workspace function uses it.
Make sure it is set first.

Change-Id: If0e52ee2fed5fdff4a11f9eb755efed593ea5439

Change-Id: Ib5b5c5916744856eca2ecaa37e949a3cdc4b3bd7

This patch adds several guidelines:

* Global constants should be ALL_CAPS (cfg => CFG)
* Prefer single-quotes over double-quotes ("foo" => 'foo')
* Place a space before TODO in comments ("#TODO" => "# TODO")

Change-Id: Ib5b5c5916744856eca2ecaa37e949a3cdc4b3bd7

commit_message:
Added some de-facto style guidelines to HACKING and fixed violations

This patch adds several guidelines:

* Global constants should be ALL_CAPS (cfg => CFG)
* Prefer single-quotes over double-quotes ("foo" => 'foo')
* Place a space before TODO in comments ("#TODO" => "# TODO")

Change-Id: Ib5b5c5916744856eca2ecaa37e949a3cdc4b3bd7

[{'created': '2013-06-14 21:20:18.000000000', 'message': 'Use Python 3.x compatible except construct

Python 3.x removed the "except x,y:" construct. Use
"except x as y:" instead which works with all
Python versions >= 2.6.

Change-Id: Iedb4c5a6d8580cbb6c9697933d006e94b1db916d
'}]
commit_message:
Use Python 3.x compatible except construct

Python 3.x removed the "except x,y:" construct. Use
"except x as y:" instead which works with all
Python versions >= 2.6.

Change-Id: Iedb4c5a6d8580cbb6c9697933d006e94b1db916d

commit_message:
Reexec devstack-vm-gate-wrap as early as possible.

* devstack-vm-gate-wrap.sh: Perform reexec step to test changes to
devstack-gate as early as possible. This is basically after the
workspace is configured.

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-12 19:54:54.000000000', 'message': 'Fix nova-compute fails to start if quantum is down

When nova-compute starts it needs to check the state of instances that
were previously running and needs to query quantum. Previously, if
it queried quantum and quantum raised an error or was unreachable
nova-compute would terminate. This patch adds a retry loop to prevent
this from happening.

Fixes bug 1186357

Change-Id: I0d865e464f7bf60a0b6dc4ca8a42436d16e29790
(cherry picked from commit 6fda12bb14ab91592910f9ebbde9ef9f8d588b08)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix nova-compute fails to start if quantum is down

When nova-compute starts it needs to check the state of instances that
were previously running and needs to query quantum. Previously, if
it queried quantum and quantum raised an error or was unreachable
nova-compute would terminate. This patch adds a retry loop to prevent
this from happening.

Fixes bug 1186357

Change-Id: I0d865e464f7bf60a0b6dc4ca8a42436d16e29790
(cherry picked from commit 6fda12bb14ab91592910f9ebbde9ef9f8d588b08)

Python3 reorganized the standard library and moved several functions
to different modules. Six provides a consistent interface
to them through the fake six.moves module.

However, the urlparse, urllib2, etc modules have been combined

commit_message:
python3: Fix import compatibility.

Python3 reorganized the standard library and moved several functions
to different modules. Six provides a consistent interface
to them through the fake six.moves module.

However, the urlparse, urllib2, etc modules have been combined
into one module which Six does not support so do it the old
fashioned way.

Change-Id: Idfb4f8eb538dcc98a1f7befc4487635d7f483973
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>

commit_message:
Move glance image service client from nova and cinder into python-glanceclient.

This is now present in nova and cinder, and it will be also needed in ironic,
so moving it into a common location.

Most of the code was present on nova.image.glance and cincer.image.glance.

glanceclient/exc.py => nova.exception <=> cinder.exception
 GlanceBaseException
 GlanceConnectionFailed
 ImageNotFound
 ImageNotAuthorized
 Invalid

tests/utils.py => nova.test <=> cinder.test
 BaseTestCase

tests/image/matchers.py => nova.tests.matchers
 DictKeysMismatch
 DictMismatch
 DictMatches

tests/unit/image/stubs.py => nova.tests.glance
tests/unit/image/test_glance.py => nova.tests.image

Added new modules from openstack-common:
 jsonutils
 fixture
 context

Change-Id: Ic387e5e76527a39a72bb4443aecc80fb02639d8f

'}, {'account_id': 1773, 'date': '2013-05-23 18:44:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

The code looks good and seems to work, but I've a design question.
I generally don't like the idea of using 'special' instances of variables that users/admins can define. So there may be users who already define a 'defaults' quota class and who would be broken by this implementation. An alternative approach would be to define a new table, 'quota_defaults' that could hold configurable limits for each quota resource."}, {'account_id': 4428, 'date': '2013-05-24 00:32:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Hi, oliver-leahy-l, thanks for your tips.

You concern makes sense, but for now only admins can create/update the quota class, actually. So the quota class is totally controlled by the admins and i think the admins must need to know that the quota class named `default` refers to the default quotas.

If we define a new table like `quota_defaults` to hold the default quotas,  as you can see new APIs should be added and this will potentialy make the codes/management more *complicated*.

So why don't we just use the existing structure to meet our needs ?"}, {'account_id': 1773, 'date': '2013-05-24 14:31:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Hm, I'm not convinced, what would happen in the case where someone had created a class called 'default' before applying this patch?

Let's see what other people think."}, {'account_id': 5538, 'date': '2013-05-27 09:01:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I agree with Oliver. One middle path I can think of is first check if a quota class by name 'defaults' already exist, but then again what will you name the new class you want to define?"}, {'account_id': 2243, 'date': '2013-06-05 03:10:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

I see both points here, however the only thing I like less than the risk of somebody having something in place already is the idea of adding yet another table, API segment and all the code associated with it.  More complex isn't always better IMO.

What do we really think that odds of somebody creating an entry named default?  What if we were more creative on the name "default_service_quotas"??  and in the migration we could always check to see if the entry exists I think, and if so fail the migration, or create with some programmatic suffix that we feed back to the admin??

Just thinking out loud here...'}, {'account_id': 4428, 'date': '2013-06-05 10:34:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 1773, 'date': '2013-06-05 11:07:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

That's good work, thank you.

However, after John's comment this morning I went to look at whether or how other projects had implemented this. Nova has implemented it exactly as you had done in patch set 3. 

So while I think this is a 'better' solution the core team might choose to use the earlier patch set to maintain consistency with other projects."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-06-05 11:27:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Works for me

Build succeeded.

'}, {'account_id': 4428, 'date': '2013-06-05 12:08:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Could any core viewers give me some clues about this? Patch set 3 for consistency with other project or the new patch ?'}, {'account_id': 1207, 'date': '2013-06-05 14:06:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Given how Nova have done it, I think patch set 3's approach is probably better. Either is better than what we have now.

In general, like Ollie, I tend to be against changes that might break existing set-ups, in this case I think, having recognised the issue, that the small risk of breaking existing setups is better than the more complex code, long term. If breaking existing setups is a real concern for people, I think we can do some clever database migration magic to work around it.

Is it possible to automatically import the current values from cinder.conf into the db at table creation time, if they are set? This would help make migration more transparent too."}, {'account_id': 4428, 'date': '2013-06-05 16:41:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 4428, 'date': '2013-06-05 16:47:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Revert to patch set 3. 

@Duncan
Sorry, it seems good that importing the current values from cinder.conf into the db at table creation time, but I have no idea about how to implement this for now.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-06-05 17:32:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Works for me

'}, {'account_id': 170, 'date': '2013-06-07 04:39:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

You now have two ways to set quotas: cinder.conf and this default quota class. The former which doesn't really do anything if set, unless you're not using the default quota class at all. This just seems confusing and especially for newcomers. I want to see mentions of this being deprecated by the options in cinder.conf and to use this quota class instead.

There should be warnings logged if ops is using the options and isn't using the quota class. I see us deprecating this for as long as OpenStack supports the version it was introduced (G?) and then we'll do hard switch in which we'll take the config opts that are still set and store that as the default quota class."}, {'account_id': 4428, 'date': '2013-06-07 08:21:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 4428, 'date': '2013-06-07 08:30:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

Hi mike, thanks for your comments.

Warning log is added to the new patch. If the default quota for a resource is setted by de default quota class, there will be a warning for the deprecated option related to the resource.

Does this make sense?'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-06-07 09:06:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: Doesn't seem to work

'}, {'account_id': 4428, 'date': '2013-06-07 15:46:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

Hi,all

New patch fixs the pep8 error and adds a warning log for the deprecated options for default quota while the default quota class is used. 

please have a review again, thanks!'}, {'account_id': 4159, 'date': '2013-06-07 16:36:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

I think the idea was to print the warning when the deprecated (aka config file) option was used instead of the class quota.

We also might add a comment to the sample config.'}, {'account_id': 4159, 'date': '2013-06-07 20:22:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I have a couple nits/questions after trying to use this.

I'm not sure it makes sense to have the magic name hidden in the sqlalchemy level. The quota_class_get_default function is identical to quota_class_get_all_by_name. I think this could be handled in db/api.py and the sqlalchemy layer left untouched.

Along that same line, if you want to actually create one of these defaults programmatically (a test maybe) you need to import from sqlalchemy.api to get the name, which feels a little dirty. I think there may be a better place to put the name. People may laugh, but config might be an option. It allows for flexibility with existing quota class names, and unit tests can just use CONF.quota_default_class_name to set up data.

As I keep rambling, another option would be to fill out the db api for full CRUD of the default quota class. In this case, we (the code, tests, etc) don't need to care about the name except for the case of existing openstack installs.

And the smallest nit, I think the name should be quota_class_get_defaults instead of singular."}, {'account_id': 4159, 'date': '2013-06-07 21:40:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8: No score

Removing the -1, but I wouldn't mind hearing what folks think of my rambling."}, {'account_id': 3191, 'date': '2013-06-10 16:34:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 1773, 'date': '2013-06-11 09:58:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

I think that Mike is asking you to add an option to the configuration file indicating that quota specification in the conf file is deprecated. 

And that the user should be able to modify the value of the new configuration option to continue using the defaults as defined in the configuration file.'}, {'account_id': 2243, 'date': '2013-06-12 04:18:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

+1 on Mike and Oliver's clarification.  After that I'm good with it again :)"}, {'account_id': 170, 'date': '2013-06-14 05:46:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

commit_message:
Editable default quota support for cinder

Implement blueprint edit-default-quota

DocImpact

Using the class quotas named `default` as the default editable quotas.

We can use the following cinderclient command to update default quota:

cinder quota-class-update default <key> <value>

Change-Id: I9f97506b41157066026dd43163ec4b1827d5b9cf

commit_message:
xenapi: ensure agent check respects image flags

The tests assumed sys_meta was in a simpler format
when accessed on the compute node. This change fixes
the code to work with the actual format of sys_meta.

Fixes bug 1190198
Change-Id: I31095e25bc86c8a475a58a7325e1ff2b3ae8e15c

subject: Fix quota bug where it raises exception when resources are deleted
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 739, 'name': 'Michael Basnight', 'email': 'mbasnight@gmail.com', 'username': 'hubcap'}, {'_account_id': 5293, 'name': 'Nikhil', 'email': 'SlickNik@gmail.com', 'username': 'slicknik'}, {'_account_id': 5390, 'name': 'Steve Leon', 'username': 'steve-leon', 'inactive': True}, {'_account_id': 7092, 'name': 'Deprecated Trove CI', 'email': 'reddwarf-jenkins@googlegroups.com', 'username': 'reddwarf', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 7273, 'name': 'Nate Bensimon', 'email': 'nate.bensimon@rackspace.com', 'username': 'nate'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-06-14 20:04:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/32660/1/check/gate-reddwarf-pep8/796 : SUCCESS in 1m 42s

'}, {'account_id': 739, 'date': '2013-06-14 20:04:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Do not merge

Im not sure i like this. it could produce an even larger bug. if your quota is at, say -700 for some silly reason, u will get to prov 700+ instances before you get quota checking done on you. I think a negative quota should raise some sort of exception. It means there is a bug in our system. Or maybe reset the quota to 0 if its negative... That might be better?

I really dont know. id like to discuss. but just making sure its > 0, i dont like'}, {'account_id': 5293, 'date': '2013-06-14 20:04:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 5390, 'date': '2013-06-14 20:04:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I think this is a different issue/bug altogether. Ideally we should have a background thread insuring that quota usages are in sync with the actual number of resources. This bug has already been filed (bug 1178333).

So if that bug is fixed, we can assume that quota will never drop below zero, thus it would not invalidate this bug.'}, {'account_id': 5390, 'date': '2013-06-14 20:04:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Also it is assumed that a negative delta[resource] is a deletion being taken place or returning resources back to the pool.

So when the delta is -700, that means 700 instances being deleted or 700gb of volume size being reduced by. Which is why the quota checking is not restricting this request'}, {'account_id': 7273, 'date': '2013-06-14 20:04:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

commit_message:
Fix quota bug where it raises exception when resources are deleted

- Added an extra check to make sure that if the delta is negative,
  it should not raise an over quota

fixed bug 1178285

Change-Id: I23cdc7bfa0a58ee87ae085d51814f73bc9790754

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-11 17:33:21.000000000', 'message': 'Remove redundant architecture property update in powervm snapshot

During an instance snapshot if the architecture property is defined
in the image it is updated twice in the snapshot image.
The snapshot is created with the metadata values from the
"instance_system_metadata" table and then, if defined, the architecture
property is updated from the value in the base image in that moment.

There is no reason to treat this property differently from others.
Also, it didn't respect the "non_inheritable_image_properties" option.

This change removes the special behavior for the architecture property
in the powervm driver during a snapshot.

Fixes bug 1189969

Change-Id: I05ebcaef7b75387827917b5b223868794d98e0aa
'}]
commit_message:
Remove redundant architecture property update in powervm snapshot

During an instance snapshot if the architecture property is defined
in the image it is updated twice in the snapshot image.
The snapshot is created with the metadata values from the
"instance_system_metadata" table and then, if defined, the architecture
property is updated from the value in the base image in that moment.

There is no reason to treat this property differently from others.
Also, it didn't respect the "non_inheritable_image_properties" option.

This change removes the special behavior for the architecture property
in the powervm driver during a snapshot.

Fixes bug 1189969

Change-Id: I05ebcaef7b75387827917b5b223868794d98e0aa

commit_message:
Initial Environment class and test

This implements the "resource-registry" and "parameters" section
I am holding off on the "properties" section until we really
know we need it.

blueprint environments
Change-Id: Ib6e9e5cd1c68c255dc048bdde21a6b3e1dc54243

commit_message:
Fix systemd services.

Systemd services should be created at /lib/systemd/system instead of
/etc/systemd/system, once the service is enabled systemd will create a
link from /lib/systemd... to /etc/systemd...

Also systemd services should contain the absolute path to the executables.

Change-Id: I741fe249de8ecc7b2af100ca6cf55c51f86f84b0

the code section below the patched line, where the correct value is used.

commit_message:
LDAP get_project_users should not return password

Also with this fix no need to skip get_project_users for LDAP.

Fixes bug1190286

commit_message:
Migrate each instances of a host to another.

Added a new extension that adds the ability for admins to migrate all
servers of a host to another available hosts.

Implements blueprint host-servers-migrate
Change-Id: I4e9c4be7ceb098d7a3bf553fd44addd46e8bce72

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-07 03:32:08.000000000', 'message': "Remove superfluous sf_volume_id reassignment

sf_volume_id was being reassigned after a new API call introduced
by a backported fix. This new API call (ModifyVolume) does not
contain the volumeID in its result.

Cloning a volume wasn't possible anymore due to a thrown error:
  KeyError: 'volumeID'

Removing the superfluous reassignment fixes the problem: sf_volume_id
is already assigned with the correct value.

Fixes: bug #1188454
Change-Id: I75196fc68666f28ac6222f43ea2ca6089b782f3f
"}]
commit_message:
Remove superfluous sf_volume_id reassignment

sf_volume_id was being reassigned after a new API call introduced
by a backported fix. This new API call (ModifyVolume) does not
contain the volumeID in its result.

Cloning a volume wasn't possible anymore due to a thrown error:
  KeyError: 'volumeID'

Removing the superfluous reassignment fixes the problem: sf_volume_id
is already assigned with the correct value.

Fixes: bug #1188454
Change-Id: I75196fc68666f28ac6222f43ea2ca6089b782f3f

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-14 13:09:50.000000000', 'message': "Fix bizarre Swift DeletionPolicy unit tests

If something shouldn't be called... don't tell the mocks to expect it to be
called. We will get UnexpectedMethodCallError if it is.

Change-Id: I61a7b77cb273b42177a37efa98fc62fd69770545
"}, {'created': '2013-06-17 10:31:14.000000000', 'message': "Fix bizarre Swift DeletionPolicy unit tests

If something shouldn't be called... don't tell the mocks to expect it to be
called. We will get UnexpectedMethodCallError if it is.

Change-Id: I61a7b77cb273b42177a37efa98fc62fd69770545
"}]
commit_message:
Fix bizarre Swift DeletionPolicy unit tests

If something shouldn't be called... don't tell the mocks to expect it to be
called. We will get UnexpectedMethodCallError if it is.

Change-Id: I61a7b77cb273b42177a37efa98fc62fd69770545

commit_message:
Use physical_resource_name() for Swift containers

This returns names which are of the same form, but which are based on the
resource id (and hence are stable).

Change-Id: Id091bdef74e07fc0df0e6e4914dae8af8b29384c

[{'created': '2013-06-14 13:09:49.000000000', 'message': 'Use physical resource names with a short_id

The short_id is a random, but stable, 12-character alphanumeric ID.

This will allow two resources of the same name to exist concurrently. That
is necessary for resources to be replaced during an update without
interruption.

Change-Id: If32904a47c6f8fb651e317ce91f2a04f6eadcc0b
'}, {'created': '2013-06-17 10:31:15.000000000', 'message': 'Use physical resource names with a short_id

The short_id is a random, but stable, 12-character alphanumeric ID.

This will allow two resources of the same name to exist concurrently. That
is necessary for resources to be replaced during an update without
interruption.

Change-Id: If32904a47c6f8fb651e317ce91f2a04f6eadcc0b
'}]
commit_message:
Use physical resource names with a short_id

The short_id is a random, but stable, 12-character alphanumeric ID.

This will allow two resources of the same name to exist concurrently. That
is necessary for resources to be replaced during an update without
interruption.

Change-Id: If32904a47c6f8fb651e317ce91f2a04f6eadcc0b

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-09 17:11:32.000000000', 'message': 'Correct preformatted text rendering in RST

Without the previous paragraph ending in ::, restructured text rendering
will run the lines into each other for the diskimage-builder
instructions.

This change introduces an additional : at the end of the previous
paragraph to force the following text to pre-formatted rendering.

Change-Id: I38cce42e623bc9121d29cc3583eed662666ec686
'}]
commit_message:
Correct preformatted text rendering in RST

Without the previous paragraph ending in ::, restructured text rendering
will run the lines into each other for the diskimage-builder
instructions.

This change introduces an additional : at the end of the previous
paragraph to force the following text to pre-formatted rendering.

Change-Id: I38cce42e623bc9121d29cc3583eed662666ec686

commit_message:
Add missing tests for cell_* methods

There was no tests in test_db_api for cell_*
methods.
Also small fix CellNotFound exception.
Add tests to ensure that all works.

blueprint db-api-tests

Change-Id: I63f3a449238f870fe2549ea5c008b636104e5002

commit_message:
Add a fixture for using of SQLite in-memory DB.

Currently, SQLite DB in a file is used for testing of DB related
code. Thus, in each test case we have to ensure that tearDown()
drops all created tables, etc. It is much easier and cleaner to
guarantee that DB is in the original state by creating it in
memory instead.

Change-Id: I6f0a9735a0fb31bef30842afff50c6089fa2bf92

commit_message:
Skip tests which test features not implemented in Quantum

Currently Quantum doesn't support all the features provided
by nova-network. Thus some tests related to features not
available in Quantum API must be skipped.

Fix Bug #1183436
Fix Bug #1182164

Change-Id: I1c6fe40e239cd0f407ffad295210adf25f95be8b

commit_message:
Add auth_admin_prefix and custom auth_uri params

auth_admin_prefix allows the prepend of a prefix to the URL used for
admin tasks.  See: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/7156/ for
implementation in Keystone.

auth_uri allows to specify the public authentication url (Keystone's
public endpoint) if it can't be guessed from $auth_host + $auth_protocol

Implements blueprint serve-keystone-from-wsgi

Change-Id: Ic66727f78406d70b5ab5bc07fcc074477df2303c

commit_message:
Use service role instead of admin role for service users

Instead of using a full admin role to validate tokens just use the
service role. Change where possible, some services use the service user
for more then just token validation.

Fixes bug 1153789

Change-Id: I0801475b62a7b025fdd871f52d8606aa614d1a32

commit_message:
Require pbr 0.5.16 or newer

Use a version of pbr greater then 0.5.15. Earlier versions have problems
when alpha tarballs are used as dependencies.

Fixes bug 1191155

Change-Id: I889358ae746761b282c5933c53bce10017be4c57
