As it stands now; I think if you follow the guide and translate <your-user-name> to "root" it will work out ok - but more to the point I think there's lots of stuff in the guide that just doesn't even make sense if you're going to do everything as root (e.g. chown root:root /var/run/swift in /etc/rc.local ???).  It's just not really a use case this guide was ment to cover, but it should be doable if someone is determined enough.

I had figured the hardest part of running swift as root (if you *really* want to!) was understanding the configuration of the user for drop_privileges so you don't get that ugly getpwnam KeyError because you don't have a user 'swift' on your system.

But it's just a guideline; for more opinionated developers, I would hope the guide serves as a way to get the general idea of what needs to happen and then let them tailor the commands to make sense for their special needs.'}, {'account_id': 6835, 'date': '2013-06-13 09:52:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

good job!'}, {'account_id': 597, 'date': '2013-06-13 13:56:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(5 inline comments)

I like the nice touches such as regularization of "your-user-name" even though RDO and Fedora add the "swift" user at package install time, regions. But the pip is a red line.'}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2013-06-13 17:07:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

(5 inline comments)

Sorry Pete, I think we've lost that battle - I'm just *trying* to keep the docs up-to-date; but probably won't be terribly persistent about it ;)

But I'd be happy to be proven wrong by some instructions for installing current swift from source on any system without making use of the cheese shop </troll>"}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2013-06-13 17:43:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-06-13 18:32:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Doesn't seem to work

[{'created': '2013-06-13 08:34:17.000000000', 'message': 'Remove Lucid/ppa instructions from SAIO guide

Lucid won't EOL until May of 2014; but I stopped trusting our ppa a long time
ago.  Besides with the requires for dnspython and mock where they're at you
almost can't install swift from source on any stock distro and expect tests to
pass with system packages - so we're looking at pypi for depends regardless.

While I'm in there:

 * more explination of <your-user-name> and a helpful find/sed for configs
 * group the "setup ~/.bashrc" stuff with the "setup ~/bin" stuff
 * some updates/fixes from my experience installing on CentOS
 * remove region warnings from remakerings

commit_message:
Remove Lucid/ppa instructions from SAIO guide

Lucid won't EOL until May of 2014; but I stopped trusting that ppa a long time
ago. Besides with the requires for dnspython and mock where they're at you
almost can't install swift from source on any stock distro and expect tests to
pass with system packages - so we're looking at pypi for depends regardless.

While I'm in there:

* more explanation of <your-user-name> and a helpful find/sed for configs
* group the "setup ~/.bashrc" stuff with the "setup ~/bin" stuff
* some updates/fixes from my experience installing on CentOS
* remove region warnings from remakerings

Change-Id: Ie2e6b06959ab699d853e07e5b7e8cda7036a44fe

commit_message:
Helper for Swift integration was added.

* We only support default configs now
* Username and Password for Swift access should be pointed during hadoop-job starting
* Tenant and Auth-Url is get from context

Implements blueprint savanna-swift-integration

Change-Id: Ifb902029ffdea6377563bcc1d2da91bd573c5901

subject: Add oauth2 to tools/pip-requires
messages:
[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-05-22 16:02:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/30126/1/check/gate-requirements-install/80 : SUCCESS in 11m 02s
'}, {'account_id': 6482, 'date': '2013-05-22 16:17:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I need the oauth2 package for createing delegated auth support for both keystone and keystoneclient. When I added it to tools/pip-requires in keystone, Jenkins came back with an error saying that it wasn't in openstack/requirements."}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2013-05-22 16:40:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Do you have any idea if it works on Python 3? It looks like the library hasn't been touched in a year, there are more than 100 open bugs and nearly 50 pull requests, is it still actively maintained? Are there other oauth libraries that may be more actively managed?"}, {'account_id': 6482, 'date': '2013-05-22 16:55:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

dhellmann: Looks like https://pypi.python.org/pypi/oauthlib promises python 2 and python 3 compatibility; it's also pretty actively maintained. 

I'll take a look and see how much work it'll be to port over the code I have made."}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2013-05-22 17:13:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Thanks, Steve, that sounds like it might be a better option.'}, {'account_id': 1, 'date': '2013-05-23 15:43:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Work In Progress

Marking WIP while Steve looks into the other option.'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-05-31 06:03:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-05-31 06:03:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 6482, 'date': '2013-06-03 20:05:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Restored'}, {'account_id': 6482, 'date': '2013-06-03 20:06:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Work In Progress'}, {'account_id': 6482, 'date': '2013-06-05 15:36:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

An update: I've tried a few other oauth python libraries, and the more popular ones have great client/consumer support, but I need provider support. Which seems to be lacking in a lot of other libraries.

I've looked at rauth, unfortunately, it only provides client/consumer support.

Also looked at oauthlib - but would require a class that extends it's Server class and would need to implement a number of abstract methods, no real easy task.

Adding termie as reviewer, he's more familiar with oauth than I am, and can hopefully recommend a course of action."}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2013-06-06 16:53:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 6482, 'date': '2013-06-06 17:04:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

dhellmann, dolphm and I have been chatting and there simply are not enough oauth providers out there, most are consumer-only implementations (rauth). I did a quick audit of the open bugs against the library, most of them are informative / usage errors, a few requests to update readme and testing, the rest are specific to certain flows, which wouldn't impact us. There is also at least one fork with a pull request to make the library python 3 compatible. From our end, it seems like python-oauth2 is a good fit."}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2013-06-06 17:28:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

I'm OK with using this if it's really the best option out there, but we should keep an eye out for updates on other projects so we can move to something more maintained when it becomes possible."}, {'account_id': 6482, 'date': '2013-06-11 20:17:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Ready For Review'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2013-06-12 14:33:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

I'm ok with it. Same comments as dhellman though."}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2013-06-14 14:45:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-06-14 14:45:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: No score

Starting gate jobs.
http://status.openstack.org/zuul/'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-06-14 14:52:55.000000000', 'content': 'Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-06-14 14:52:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/30126/1/gate/gate-requirements-install/134 : SUCCESS in 7m 26s
'}]

The vnethost module can be loaded for added performance, so

commit_message:
Add note about vnethost for KVM

The vnethost module can be loaded for added performance, so
created a stub section on KVM performance.

There were some build failures to do with dashboard files
moving around, so fixed those up too.

fixes bug 1064757

Change-Id: Ibcd1797c8db0d0a147a64e567a95ce13f4bd1d3a

using openvswitch as it invokes rootwrap twice every 4 seconds)

    Author: Gary Kotton <gkotton@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Do not import anything from quantum into rootwrap

The rootwrapper is special and shouldn't do heavy code
loading, first for performance and 2nd for potential
security issues.

It shaves off 0.2s of load time (aka heavy cpu usage when
using openvswitch as it invokes rootwrap twice every 4 seconds)

Fixes LP bug 1190675

This is reverting bug 1053381

    Author: Gary Kotton <gkotton@redhat.com>
    Date:   Sun Sep 23 08:34:33 2012 +0000

        Uses a common subprocess popen function

Change-Id: I629d90aaeb99b225d716da82c6ac5c3f327ebb67

[{'created': '2013-06-14 06:29:25.000000000', 'message': 'Do not open /dev/zero with O_DIRECT.

/dev/zero does not support O_DIRECT, and so when clearing a volume to
be deleted, the current code does not open the destination device with
O_DIRECT either. This patch removes O_DIRECT from the source when
clearing.

Change-Id: I7f704098cfd12347ca549d58776ce90bea19e07d
Fixes: bug 1190868
'}]
commit_message:
Do not open /dev/zero with O_DIRECT.

/dev/zero does not support O_DIRECT, and so when clearing a volume to
be deleted, the current code does not open the destination device with
O_DIRECT either. This patch removes O_DIRECT from the source when
clearing.

Change-Id: I7f704098cfd12347ca549d58776ce90bea19e07d
Fixes: bug 1190868

commit_message:
engine : Resource separate state_set action/status

Split the resource state action/status, which will allow us
to more easily refactor state-transition logic to reduce
duplication

Change-Id: I6287be3f011ec6b9a2951c566d2214a5ef84adbd

[{'created': '2013-06-13 18:12:04.000000000', 'message': "Store stacks in the database when running unit tests

If stacks are not stored in the database before they are create()'d,
anything that refers to a stack (e.g. Resources and Events) cannot be added
to the database either, and we get numerous errors in any output logs.

Change-Id: Icd1012455d413aad617486c138fd4507e391bc7b
"}, {'created': '2013-06-14 10:32:45.000000000', 'message': "Store stacks in the database when running unit tests

If stacks are not stored in the database before they are create()'d,
anything that refers to a stack (e.g. Resources and Events) cannot be added

Change-Id: Icd1012455d413aad617486c138fd4507e391bc7b

commit_message:
Store stacks in the database when running unit tests

If stacks are not stored in the database before they are create()'d,
anything that refers to a stack (e.g. Resources and Events) cannot be added
to the database either, and we get numerous errors in any output logs.

Change-Id: Icd1012455d413aad617486c138fd4507e391bc7b

[{'created': '2013-06-13 18:12:04.000000000', 'message': 'Unit tests: Create User for testing AccessKey

An AccessKey resource is not independent of its associated User resource,
which must be present in the same stack. Consequently, we need to create a
real User resource that is a member of the same stack in order to test the
AccessKey in a realistic environment.

Change-Id: I4b732c93fe9823552baf65c3f9c87c8ebab061a4
'}, {'created': '2013-06-14 10:32:46.000000000', 'message': 'Unit tests: Create User for testing AccessKey

An AccessKey resource is not independent of its associated User resource,
which must be present in the same stack. Consequently, we need to create a
real User resource that is a member of the same stack in order to test the
AccessKey in a realistic environment.

Change-Id: I4b732c93fe9823552baf65c3f9c87c8ebab061a4
'}]
commit_message:
Unit tests: Create User for testing AccessKey

An AccessKey resource is not independent of its associated User resource,
which must be present in the same stack. Consequently, we need to create a
real User resource that is a member of the same stack in order to test the
AccessKey in a realistic environment.

Change-Id: I4b732c93fe9823552baf65c3f9c87c8ebab061a4

commit_message:
Check if auth_admin_prefix is defined

Check if auth_admin_prefix is defined (passed as a parameter to api.pp)
before trying to access it in the settings data structure.

Change-Id: I61a3ae41dca2a5e5bd9e635b0a2ab9eb05b0326a
Fixes: bug #1190481

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-03 15:54:28.000000000', 'message': 'Default to sending messages with RPC envelope

The ZMQ driver was, per Grizzly, defaulting to
sending messages with the RPC envelope disabled.

When the RPC envelope was turned on globally,
this did not take immediate effect for the ZMQ
driver due to how optional-envelope support
was implemented for notifications.

This patch simply changes the envelope kwarg default
from False to True. The notify() in rpc/common.py
defaults its envelope parameter to False, overriding
this default when notifications are sent.

Fixes bug 1187036

Change-Id: I53e14c6937b0fc3879dcb8fbed19310c244f2e61
'}]
commit_message:
Default to sending messages with RPC envelope

The ZMQ driver was, per Grizzly, defaulting to
sending messages with the RPC envelope disabled.

When the RPC envelope was turned on globally,
this did not take immediate effect for the ZMQ
driver due to how optional-envelope support
was implemented for notifications.

This patch simply changes the envelope kwarg default
from False to True. The notify() in rpc/common.py
defaults its envelope parameter to False, overriding
this default when notifications are sent.

Fixes bug 1187036

Change-Id: I53e14c6937b0fc3879dcb8fbed19310c244f2e61

natural order. This patch sorts the networks honor requested nic
ordering when Nova calls the nova-network API.

(cherry picked from commit 90d3371be6c7ec2fc85c92f4744adf4f83003522)'}]
commit_message:
Make nova-network support requested nic ordering

The nova-network did not honor nic ordering, so nics were attached in db
natural order. This patch sorts the networks honor requested nic
ordering when Nova calls the nova-network API.

Fixes bug: #1170725

Change-Id: Idf76623d7eea4613a2bccde2d7149dccaf840a46
Signed-off-by: Zhi Yan Liu <zhiyanl@cn.ibm.com>
(cherry picked from commit 90d3371be6c7ec2fc85c92f4744adf4f83003522)

So far,
 0. the sshd_config editing is off, needs s/^PasswordAuthentication no/PasswordAuthentication yes/ -- ultimately will need a less fragile config editor e.g. http://augeas.net/docs/references/lenses/files/sshd-aug.html
 1. the hadoop install with rpm2cpio results in things like /usr/usr/bin/hadoop -- why not just rpm -ivh?"}, {'account_id': 7555, 'date': '2013-06-07 01:44:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Actually, skip the ^ in the sed.

Also, you can --force the rpm -ivh. A patch should be sent to upstream Apache Hadoop to stop producing an RPM that claims to own /usr/bin, /usr/sbin, /usr/lib and /usr/lib64.

After that it should just be hadoop install tweaking to make sure scripts find /usr/java/jdk1.6.0_43/bin/java'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-06-14 06:03:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Abandoned

commit_message:
Refactor libvirt driver exception handling

Centralize exception handling for id based instance lookups in new
method _lookup_by_id().

Change-Id: If8d215b85fabf235afcf78a9203378fbb26e68db

commit_message:
Register libvirt driver with closed connection callback

libvirt v1.0.1 and later support a callback to alert clients
when the connection is lost.  The libvirt driver will now
register for this callback when available so that the driver
can properly reconnect.

Fixes: bug #1154635
Change-Id: Ie5f1b69cf6f0655022148386cd2be9955d37b467

commit_message:
InstanceInteropHelper improvements

* Added multiple file transfering in a single ssh session
* Leveled up ssh.open() and close() invocations in class methods

Improves blueprint instance-interop-helper

Change-Id: Ia57c60bcdc3f1bafd33ca58ea98d0f56e895192e

commit_message:
Fix the wrong reference by CONF

CONF.set_defaults(CONF, web='/usr/share/novnc') should be
CONF.set_default('web', '/usr/share/novnc')

Fixes: bug #1190628
Change-Id: I7ff12d10ed423fa6518b8674b80d0e1cc1787a8b

commit_message:
Rename to os-apply-config.

The name os-config-applier was too confusing given os-refresh-config as the
partner program, so we've decided to rename to os-apply-config.

To aid migration the old command name and default template path are still
supported.

Change-Id: I39725595275e7b4375ac4fda52e6a14b7071f7e9

A long time ago, quantum/tests/unit became the home for all unit
tests, but these ones in the Cisco plugin directory got left
behind. They have suffered bit-rot and need to be removed.

Also:
- Move the fake Nexus driver to new home.
- Filed new bugs to track the task of improving unit test coverage of
  Cisco plugin code.

Fixes: bug #1174311
Change-Id: I372e24aebbe1804e5b6ce62984bfd76b030a44b1

commit_message:
Remove unit tests that are no longer run.

A long time ago, quantum/tests/unit became the home for all unit
tests, but these ones in the Cisco plugin directory got left
behind. They have suffered bit-rot and need to be removed.

Also:
- Move the fake Nexus driver to new home.
- Filed new bugs to track the task of improving unit test coverage of
  Cisco plugin code.

Fixes: bug #1174311
Change-Id: I372e24aebbe1804e5b6ce62984bfd76b030a44b1

commit_message:
drop user and group constraints

Drop foreign keys that point to user and group tables from
other tables. This is required to be able to split up the backends.

Blueprint extract-projects-from-id

Change-Id: Iea78ddca4ef5ea5ca1bb542cba81da8aefa95b6b

commit_message:
Use Python 3.x compatible except construct

Per (proposed) Hacking check, use except x as y:
instead of x,y:, which works with any Python version >= 2.6

Change-Id: I6e52cedec5c694bccae10541b1964a8547d4ffd1

'}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2013-06-14 01:25:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

I think this is fine, however, it would be good to make sure there is some good filtering in the Dom0 plugin.'}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2013-06-14 01:25:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Neither the bug nor this patch gives insight into why removing the filtering is necessary.  Is the problem that the rootwrap filtering has become too stringent?  

The consensus in the L2 review - from both Dan and John - was that the domU rootwrap filtering should be done as a safeguard against divergence between the domU filtering and the xapi plugin filtering, and I'd like to ensure that we continue to do this if possible."}, {'account_id': 5044, 'date': '2013-06-14 01:25:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

@John:
The ALLOWD_CMDS is the "filter" at the moment:
https://github.com/openstack/quantum/blob/master/quantum/plugins/openvswitch/agent/xenapi/etc/xapi.d/plugins/netwrap#L35'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-06-14 01:25:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/31077/2/check/gate-quantum-pep8/7523 : SUCCESS in 1m 43s
- http://docs-draft.openstack.org/31077/2/check/gate-quantum-docs/6762/doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 1m 27s
- http://logs.openstack.org/31077/2/check/gate-quantum-python26/7137 : SUCCESS in 17m 08s

- http://logs.openstack.org/31077/2/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-quantum/27014 : SUCCESS in 22m 01s
'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-06-14 01:25:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: No score

Starting gate jobs.
http://status.openstack.org/zuul/'}, {'account_id': 704, 'date': '2013-06-14 01:25:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

Agreed with Maru, Approving this patch!'}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2013-06-14 01:25:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

OK, so the new approach in patchset 2 look good.'}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2013-06-14 01:25:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Ah yes, I remember my thinking about this now... my bad.

The problem is there is no simple way to make this DRY.

Given biggest security risk with root wrap is a admin api being exploited, the double filter helps with this protection.

I didn't want an open execution API on XenServer, but that shouldn't be exposed to end users, so I am less worried about how tight that is.

So I think, after some thought, the best approach is the two layer protection, but I am open to other suggestions and ideas."}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2013-06-14 01:25:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Code looks good. I do not have the ability to test it.'}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2013-06-14 01:25:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

Let's not hold this up.  I'd like to see changes from a vendor (in this case Citrix) that doesn't yet have core status go in so long as it passes a basic smell test.  Just as we approve code from other vendors without being able to test things ourselves, we need to allow XCP/XS devs the same latitude."}, {'account_id': 5044, 'date': '2013-06-14 01:25:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 5044, 'date': '2013-06-14 01:25:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

@Maru: The error message in the bug is saying, that it failed to find an executable filter. It was due to the fact, that exec_dirs were not loaded from the config file.

I think this approach is not better than the previous, as at the moment we are making filter decisions based on the filesystem of the domU to execute commands on dom0.

Apart from that, I think this approach hurts the SRP from SOLID'}, {'account_id': 5044, 'date': '2013-06-14 01:25:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

@John: So, if you think, that the BEST solution is to have the two layer protection, why did you -1 my change? My change is about making the dom0 wrapper able to parse exec_dirs, thus behave like a domU one.'}, {'account_id': 6735, 'date': '2013-06-14 01:25:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

> At the moment we are making filter decisions based on the filesystem of the domU to execute commands on dom0.

I think this is a good case for a second bug and a discussion about how best to fix that.  Clearly decisions based in DomU may not be safe when running that command in DomO... So unless the checking is identical in the two places isn't this a potential security issue?"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-06-14 01:25:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Verified

Build succeeded.

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-14 01:25:17.000000000', 'message': 'xenapi: do not filter commands

The quantum-rootwrap-xen-dom0 talks to dom0 through XenAPI, and a plugin
will execute the requested commands in dom0. The netwrap plugin filters
the commands, so there is no need to do filtering in domU, as the
context is not given at that point.

Fixes bug 1185872

Change-Id: I10175c7df5d34e47eb6044711ffbe4fe4cee3ce2
'}, {'created': '2013-06-14 01:25:17.000000000', 'message': 'xenapi: fix rootwrap

The xenapi root wrapper did not parse the "exec_dirs" parameter, so it
failed to execute the commands. This patch works around this problem by
parsing the "exec_dirs".

Fixes bug 1185872

Change-Id: I10175c7df5d34e47eb6044711ffbe4fe4cee3ce2
'}]
commit_message:
xenapi: fix rootwrap

The xenapi root wrapper did not parse the "exec_dirs" parameter, so it
failed to execute the commands. This patch works around this problem by
parsing the "exec_dirs".

Fixes bug 1185872

Change-Id: I10175c7df5d34e47eb6044711ffbe4fe4cee3ce2
